text: 5 Star to 1 star.  Update. 11/12/20 it appears they have to close for A LUNCH BREAK!!. Whenever they feel like it! This is sad, so many people trying to mail packages... just a sign on the inside door "Out  to lunch "!! No time frame!! Seriously!

name: Kam Wall
text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would. Your employees are very rude, lack common courtesy & does not have the communication skills to be working for the USPS post office. I will be getting the information of the young lady who answered the phone "OH MY GOD" before speaking to me.

name: VictorAlexSaavedra
text: They’ve been on “lunch break” for 2 hours. Standing in line with 6 other people waiting for them to get back. What a joke of a place.

name: Linda Brady
text: They won't even answer the phone. Mail is sent back for me to pick up..for no reason. Ridiculous

name: Edward Cole
text: This location only takes debit, credit, and checks for payment. This is a problem when you need a money order and can only pay with cash.

name: Karen Turpin
text: I honestly should not have even given one star.  I have lived in Bluff Park over 12 years and try to make it a point to never come here.  The sweetest little community with the WORST post office ever.  If you are going to work in a job where you communicate with people, either do it in a polite way or get another job.  Be rude to me...that’s bad enough; however, to be rude to my 6 year old - is pretty pathetic.  Oh well, guess it’s a good early life lesson to my kids that people who work at this post office always have been and always will be RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Kasey Davis
text: Not worthy of even a single star. Postal delivery persons vary and are inconsistent in delivering or picking up mail. We had outgoing mail in our exterior box with the flag up for 3 days this week and postal person never took it and today actually just lowered the flag without taking the mail but placed incoming mail in the lower portion of the box... We also often receive other people's mail who aren't even in the same area.

name: The Dream Peddlery by J.Nisbet-Hoyle
text: This is THE WORST usps post office that I have EVER been to. The ladies that sit, (yes, SIT. Most postal employees stand and move) behind the counter are RUDE, unfriendly and act constantly exasperated. They don't like answering questions. They don't want to take the second it takes to print out a receipt for pre-paid packages. It's really quite amazing that the management lets them work there. The scanners don't scan and they tell you it's your fault. I'll do anything not to have to go into this post office. Thank goodness for the scheduled pick up that USPS offers. If I have to go to the post office I will drive a few miles further and get excellent service with scanners and employees that do a good job. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS ONE!!!!

name: Jennifer Metcalf Rigg
text: I WILL NEVER USE THE P.O. AT SJADES MTN PLAZA AGAIN AND I WILL BE SURE EVERYONE I KNOW WILL NOT AS WELL. On 11/14/16 the employee working that day was the rudest person ever who should NOT be working customer service. NOT only was when talking to me like I was a complete idiot, BUT what was so disturbing to cause me to take time out of my day to write a review was an elderly lady came in behind me she could barely walk had a kane from her obvious scoliosis stepped close to the stamp display case to SEE stamps and the employee RUDELY TOLD HER TO GET BACK BEHIND THE LINE! The poor lady looked scared too death and walked out and so did I. Pray for the lady who works there as well, she obviously needs Jesus!

name: Priscilla Perez
text:
Went in today to drop off a pre-paid package and the lady told me she could not ship it because my label had a date (July 23, the day the item that was purchased), and said it was too late and that I was going to have to print out another label that's more recent. I told her that was the date the item was purchased and that I've never had a problem shipping my packages 6 days later.

I don't have the convenience of a printer at home so I wasn't able to print the label until the 25th while at school, and have not been able to get to the post office until today (29th), and now she tells me I won't be able to ship my package AND I have to print another label???

I had to waste more gas and drive to another location to drop off my package. Do not go to this post office, this lady will profile you and be rude and uphelful if she doesn't like something about you.

For the record, I took my package straight to The Hoover Mail Center by the Sunoco gas station on 31 and they had no problem with my package!

name: Mike Williams
text: This place SUCKS DONT STOP HERE IT SUCKS BAD #SUCKIEST POST OFFICE EVER!!!"

text: Automation says package delivered to my box. No it is not. I want my package. Why is it no person answers a phone just a crazy automated voice that does not give you the information you want. Why all the garbage about COVID  get over it.

text: I don’t think the mailman can read! Half the time we get other people mail or our mail end up in their mailbox. And I was supposed to received a package Saturday. Never got it! It said it was delivered so where the heck is it?

name: Ckss Bush
text:
My first time at this location and was an awful experience. The guy working there needs to not work with the public he is very rude and not helpful at all.
Come on Postal Service set standards and hold your employees liable ... DO BETTER

name: Katherine s
text: I have always had a good experience doing business at this post office. Anytime I have had any issues with deliveries the staff have been very cooperative and sincerely concerned with resolving the problem. Right now there seems to be some confusion with deliveries to my address due to the city transitioning residents from numbered lee road addresses to street addresses with names. I hope this will be resolved soon as I do a lot of online shopping.

name: christopher yingling
text: First off I didn’t appreciate being profiled when I came in to this post office to do a money order transaction. The woman in the back who started to make up that emails came in saying that everyone has to be carded for making a money order transactions. Even tho both employees in the front said that wasn’t protocol with the amount I was getting. I just want to say thank you for profiling me because I have tattoos all over me. Guess if I was still wearing the uniform it wouldn’t have been an issue. Just know that your services at this post office will no longer be of use to me and my business.

name: randy hall
text: I have had no problems here. My daughter lives out of state so I ship often. They always give an accurate arrival date even during the holidays and their staff is great. They both say in transit. I called to speak with the Post Master. They took my name and number and have not called me back since..... Not impressed at all.

resp.text: I am really sorry we couldn't help you yesterday with your USAA deposit. I did a review of the security tapes and found that we were on the dot of closing at 6:30. Once we close, we cannot access the systems to do a deposit. If you know you are running a little late, please give the store a call and let us see if we can't wait for you and process your transaction. We value your business and feedback.

resp.text: I am so sorry that you had a bad experience at The UPS Store. We strive to give world class service every day. Sometimes we fail. We have discussed your situation and have learned how to better serve you when you return. We value your business and hope you will give us another try soon. Clare, owner The UPS Store

name: Maleika Rene'
text: The owner of this UPS franchise is unfair in her business practices!  My mother (senior citizen) rented a box from her store and realized that it's not the box that she needed and the owner would not refund her or allow her to get out of the box.  It was less than 24 hours.  The price of the box is RIDICULOUS and I know because I own 3 PMBs with 2 of them being at UPS stores.  This store and a couple of others in the area are definitely price gauging and need to be ashamed of themselves.  As a business owner, it's one thing to make a profit, it's another thing to be absolutely ridiculous with human errors.  Some policies CAN be adjusted.  Just remember, KARMA is real and the BBB and UPS headquarters will know about this incident.  As soon as her contract is up, she will be moving to a UPS store that has sense and truly CARES about their customers...not just taking their money for profit!

The person I talked to on the phone, employee of the store,  was not helpful at all.

I miss having the drop off on the curve but it is a minor quibble.

text: I used to come here all the time to mail my packages, but I have not been here in almost a year. The service in general was slow, but the location was convenient. One of the postal workers refused to scan and accept my packages last December about two or three weeks before Christmas. She said I could put them in the bin outside the lobby. I left and have never been back. I took my packages to the downtown post office where they scanned and accepted them.

name: Corinna Bass
text:
This place is a nightmare for anyone looking for something as basic as a money order- how does a post office run out of money orders??
Also, make sure you have several different kinds of currency options because sometimes they can’t take cash, or sometimes their computer is down and can’t take cards. Everytime I’ve been in there, there is only one cashier- and there is always a line. Hey Post master, is this really a post office??

name: Mel M
text: The man at the counter is extremely rude to the point I am canceling my po Box.  They take weeks to deliver to the po Box and it's in the back the whole time but they refuse to look until days later.  I have had 2 encounters with the man at the front desk. The first time a package wasn't delivered and was a week past the confirmed delivery date he sent me away 3 times stating my package wasn't here and refused to go in the back.  Well it took 4 times and it was back there the whole time.  Today I go in with a tracking confirmation and he does the same thing and rudely tells me it's not here and again refused to even look at my tracking number.  So I have to wait another few weeks to get a package that in their back office again.  Seriously terrible service, rude for no reason.

name: Rachel McGuff
text: What an absolute joke. I had a package marked as delivered (it was not), and I followed the steps to open a case online. I received an email stating they would follow up with me and never did. Can’t get anyone on the phone, and my case has been marked as resolved. Glad to see my tax dollars going to great use

name: Aditi
text: had a package marked as delivered (it was not), and I followed the steps to open a case online. I received an email stating they would follow up with me and never did. Can’t get anyone on the phone,  this is so frustrating!!!!

text: We had a great experience here! The service was fast and the gentleman helping us was very kind to my daughter.

name: Elaine B
text: Rude, rude, rude. They’re not welcoming. You can come in and speak and say something as simple as, “Hello, how are you today?” and get no response or hello back from them. Once you’re done with your transaction, they basically just shoo you out of there. They no longer leave the prepaid label/package basket out for convenience instead of having to wait in line. You can go DURING business hours and the doors to the clerk window will be closed and locked. I went in yesterday and had a package with an incorrect label and the lady talked to me as if I was a child. I won’t be going back to this location.

text: I will say the lady is efficient. Wants to get the job done but that it. There was no greetings of any kind, not even a smile. She Barely spoke. I would expect a better attitude especially in the times we’re in now. A smile goes a long way miss, might even makes your day go a bit faster, nicer and make someone day a little better! Kindness is free.

text: They stole my birthday present and when my aunt resent it they tried to steal that too. We had insurance on the second package thank God or we would have had 2 stolen packages. They never fixed the first problem but they were able to fix the second problem after 2 weeks of phone tag.

text:
First of all I would like to let you all know that this location is not the location that delivers your mail and packages.This location only does PO Boxes and they do a superb job in doing that and they also sell stamps and whatever needs you have on the counter .The  facility that you need to review is the one at Green Springs Carrier Facility at 285 Snow Drive .You're giving this location a very bad rating which it does not deserve
.

name: C Tyree
text: The racist employees of this location are rude and racist towards customers.   It’s close to my house so I went here a few times along with my spouse to ship a package or two.  What a sad experience.  Did I mention the employees here are racists?

name: Drea Denise
text: Just went here a few minutes ago, to see where my package was, because they didn’t leave a notice or anything. So when I get there, it takes me 15 minutes to be greeted. A man asked me the problem and I let him know I have moved and since my address has changed and my package was suppose to have been shipped to my old address before my mail got changed over and how they didn’t leave a notice. Now, he closes the door mid sentence, and then the lady that was on the phone for that 15 minutes instead of doing her job after I pressed that service bell 5 Times, she came to the window being extra loud instead of explaining it because how in the hell am I suppose to know any of this if a notice was not sent. She was loud and rude and I basically grabbed my stuff up and left because darling, y’all customer service is beyond horrible. I hope to never come back here period. She informed me that my package was sent back to Florida and is being sent back, how in the hell am I suppose to know this? I’ll wait

name: Yemimah Johnson
text: Wish I could give this location zero stars! Dropped a package off 3 weeks ago, and just found out that it's still sitting at the post office!! Not only that, I mailed out an important letter over 2 months ago, and the recipient never received it to this day. The lines are usually long at this location, with only one Clerk working the counter. Please get the other workers in the back to help! Overhaul needed desperately here ASAP. Change is in order!!!!!

name: Emma Budraitis
text:
I cannot give this location low enough stars. It is the worst Post Office I have ever experienced.  I don't normally give bad reviews, but every time I have been to this post office there have been problems. Meaning they don't have the stamps I need. What's a post office without stamps?!
In my experience they usually only have one worker at the counter helping customers, so there is a line out the door. The first time I went there they did not have post card stamps, and told me, with an attitude that I would have to get them somewhere else. (I'm sorry, I thought I was at the post office.)
The second time I went for Christmas stamps, which they had, but when I inquired about purchasing normal Forever stamps, the lady opened her draw, said she had none and walked away from her lane, saying she was closed. This left me standing there, wondering if anyone was going to help me, if she was coming back, or if the other worker even acknowledge what just happened. Thankfully she helped me after she finished with her customer, only to find out that she too did not have any Forever stamps. I resorted to purchasing additional Christmas stamps instead.
This location has always seemed inefficient, ill-supplied, and the workers incompetent. You ask a question and they just stare at you, then slowly respond with a poor answer. I hate to review this so poorly, but it's just the truth.
Pick another location to take care of your mailing needs.

name: Ann Thompson
text: I didnt recieve package as indicated by tracking info. They were incredibly helpful and reasonably prompt investigating the  packages where abouts. Concluded with my recieving package only 3 days later than estimated by Amazon.

name: The Mingus Files

I have had packages sent back because the carrier said undeliverable when it absolutely is. I've had them say business not open when it is clearly our business hours. These people are lazy and half assed.

text: Rude

text:
Been on hold for about 50 minutes uggghhhhh

After several call backs I'm back on hold again uggghhhhh, the girl that was helping first just left me on hold abs left for the day smh

name: Tykira Mumphrey
text: They are stealing Christmas gifts !!

name: Zuliam Aguirre
text: Great customer service

name: Joe D
text: post office not at this location

name: Remy Way
text: I moved from Colorado, and this location blows all the usps locations in Colorado out of the water. This is the best USPS location I have been to, and I go there at least twice a week. Keep up the solid work, thank you.

name: jesse wilkins
text: They said they tried to deliver my package and was unsuccessful.. This is a lie because I was in my front yard cleaning the yard all day untill 8:00 p.m..I seen the mail man come down my street, but never delivered my package..

name: Valarie Hansen
text: Went to pick up my mail from being on hold and the lady told me I had no  mail at all even trash mail  after being gone for 2 weeks????? Ridiculous!!! We ALWAYS have trash mail every single day and I know when my power bill is due. Just didn't want to take time to look since it got busy behind me.

name: Joel Stampede
text:
"The people are nice but sometimes they are slow or don't know what they are doing."

Well said.  Expanding on that, I will say that no matter how many people are waiting, the pace never picks up, and it always takes both clerks to try and solve one problem.

Added to that, if I bring in a package at 8 A.M. on Monday, according to the Tracking Number, the package never leaves the Theodore Post office until Tuesday evening.

name: Michael Burrough
text: Totally unreliable mail delivery.  Some days the carrier doesn't show up at all and other days doesn't deliver the mail until after 5pm. I don't understand, really I don't. Going in the post office is also always a terrible experience. SO SLOW!!! Always only one employee working the counter even when the line is out the door. When someone mentions something to her she smirks and says that she is retired and doesn't need this job and that she just works there for something the do, which is exactly how she acts. I have heard her say this a few time, once to me directly. She is "nice" but it's a phony, fake nice, masochist nice, as to say "If you don't like it then leave", with a smile. The other employees there are rude and condescending and causally walk around listening to their headphones or talking and joking with each other like they are on the playground, meanwhile there are customers waiting for the only desk clerk working. The WORST post office and customer service ever, and they NEVER answer the phone. If I could give 0 stars I would. Something needs to be done because these people are going to run the post office outta busniess. UNPROFESSIONAL! And these are supposed to be government employees!?

name: Tameka Love
text: Call the post office because I was missing a package that they supposed to deliver. I spoke to Greg the supervisor at the Theodore location and like any conversation I start off with speaking "Hi, how are doing?" His reply "Busy. What you need?" After telling them all the information; the tone in his voice, the words he used; I clearly could tell he cared less.

name: Janice Desantis
text: Sat. 7/1/2017 = NO MAIL AS OF 5:02 PM, for the entire residential development = WHAT GIVES?????   I love our mail-delivery person, but they must be on holiday as our usual delivery time is about 11:30 am, and today, no mail at all for anyone .... USPS is supposed to be open today, but you can't reach them after 11am on a Saturday, and it's the 4th of July holiday = figures!!

name: Angela Serigny
text: The mail carrier won't bring any packages to our house and they always mix- up mail with our neighbors and ours. The only time the carrier actually came to our house was when she was training someone, that confirmed that they know for sure where the house is but simply refuses to deliver anything to our home. The times I've been in this post office there's always a line and the last time I was going to overnight express mail a package to my daughter but all the clerk would tell me is I had the wrong box and I'd need to use their other box; she said it was over there and pointed instead of helping me. She could've rang up the right box with the express delivery so all I'd have to do was bring it back to her after I switched boxes even though the box I'd used was no problem with a different post office about a month prior to this visit. I've got severe back problems, Neuropathy, and other medical problems and after standing in the line I just wanted to leave before collapsing. I paid to send it within a 2 - 3 day arrival because that's the box the clerk told me I had. Next time I'll probably just go to a different post office.

name: Chris Knight
text: Man worst branch ever!!! Extremely rude and petty and beyond that don't even follow the post offices orders like refused to hold my mail on several occasions when I had a hold mail put in with confirmation number

name: Alicia Robertson
text: Horrible customer service. One time when I went I was asked to put my address on the screen for conformation, I did, the lady said put your address. I responded with I put it down, she then told me to do it again because it wasn’t right. My most recent time of going, I was picking up a package for my mom, said my address, was asked for my address again, then I had to figure out that he meant my license to see my address. I was never asked for my address. They are not welcoming at this location.

name: Calypso Olivia
text: Horrible customer service! I called in to find out if my package was there because for whatever reason they decided not to deliver it to me & the guy told me he couldn’t help me at all without a tracking number and then hung up on me! I called back once I had my tracking information and the man refused to help me. Said he was too busy helping others and I would just have to come in! I told him I couldn’t because of my work hours and he basically said oh well I’m busy trying to help the two customers in front of me! How rude and unprofessional.

name: Cornbread- 83
text: The people are nice but I never know when to expect my mail somedays it around 11am and others it's after 2 pm

name: Chilton Morgan
text: Was expecting my package today but it never showed up.... who delivers mail at 8 at night anyways?!.....

name: Denise Brown
text: The 2 ladies working up front are rude a-- b----

name: stephanie holsombach
text: the mail carrier, who has delivered packages to our house before, decided to leave a box marked PERISHABLE on our camper steps.....The camper isnt even parked down the driveway

text: They steal everything.  90% of the time. My mail never makes it. It gets lost at there post office!

text: I waited till the 8:30 and walked up to the door and seen they put a sticker that is hand written that says 9:00 this is very unprofessional

text: The employees I dealt with while trying to send a money order were rude and condescending.

name: Michael Price-Williams
text: Nice main branch

name: Ashley Hitt
text: never answer the phones!!!!

name: Savannah Rose
text: This post office is amazing!! I run a small business and live closer to the slocomb post office than Dothan, even though Dothan is my home post office. I can’t comment as far as mail delivery BUT I drop packages off here sometimes because of convenience and they always get scanned out on time. The employees are kind and seem like they actually care. I haven’t experienced that with other post offices. THANK YOU SLOCOMB POST OFFICE!!

name: G Bullard
text: Kisha and Miranda are very knowledgeable and always helpful.  Thank you ladies.

name: Titus Prevatt
text: I was expecting a letter from overseas.  The letter was sent with the wrong zip code and I was afraid we might never see this letter.  I talked with Keisha, at the Slocomb post office,  about the matter.  She took down the information and stayed on top of this  for me, tracking the letter as it made it's way through the system.    The USPS could use more employees like Keisha and more post offices like the Slocomb Post Office.

name: Elizabeth Peavey
text: Very friendly and ready to help with anything you might need. Keisha is a very kind person. She always has a smile and a helping hand.

name: Cathy Solis
text: The personnel here in Slocomb are kind & helpful. It is always a pleasure to be in their presence.

name: Rena Cosby
text: Let me tell you about Abbeville,Alabama  mail carriers  Angela Nell is mine and she goes beyond her job title she is a caring considerate person and will help her residents. Also there are a lot more carriers that care such as Kendra Fleming who always has a smile on her face Cody Young is a fine young man so Abbeville is blessed to have these carriers with a kind ❤

name: Melissa Hix
text: Tired of my pickup requests not being honored 😡 in addition to some packages not be delivered to me on time when they arrive in Abbeville with enough time to be delivered that day... But multiple times I've had packages that were time sensitive where i requested a pickup the next day and had my packages out and ready to just be ignored by the carrier. It was the last straw today when the carrier came up to the house to deliver some packages, sat them down NEXT TO the packages I had put out for pickup and then he turned around and left, leaving my packages! 😡 Now my packages are going to be late, and for a small business that I do from my home, that does not look good. Time to get it together Abbeville! When yall start acting like a REAL post office, the review will change..

name: Jeremy Moore
text: The only reason this USPS is getting any stars more than 1 is because the lady who delivers my mail is very kind. The gentleman I spoke to on the phone today I believe he said his name was Brett. I called this morning from Georgia, unaware of the timezone change. I place my phone on speaker while it rang 9 minutes before they opened because I was at work. The phone rang for 51 seconds before someone picked up and hung up. I thought it was an honest mistake. I called back, this is when someone picks up immidiately to quickly respond with a long phrase to which is was unintelligible but the end of the sentence was "we open at 9 okay bye", with no time to even apologize for not realizing the time difference. I call back at 1001 eastern time now being that it is 901 in alabama, same guy answers. I asked him if he was the gentleman I had recently spoken too? He immidiately gets defensive and says we were not open you need to call back at 9 when we open, to which I replied it is 901. He proceeds to attempt to rush me off the phone to get back to loading packages. He is clearly upset with how the 9 minutes prior to this call has gone. I was calling to ask to have my packages held at the location because of how many will be coming in between now and Friday so as to not inconvenience them with a large amount of packages over a few days. Due to him being immediately cynical of how he assumed I was just being annoying with the phone ringing "50 times" in his words,, which when would it ever be justifiable to answer and hang up? I'm just going to call back? Why be so negative? I was trying to do you a favor. My packages left the carrier facility at 647 this morning in abbeville, I live 6 minutes away by car. It is 607 at night. Still hasn't arrived. Thats okay. I really hope you can have a better day tomorrow brett, and not assume everyone is trying to do bad and wrong.

name: Mary Suarez
text: The ladies who work here are always ready to help and sweet as can be

name: Mike Allen
text: This place of "business" is a joke. I spoke with a woman on the phone today and she was possibly one of the rudest people I've ever dealt with. Zero customer service skills. She is a prime example of why the United States Postal Service is a failing business. Use UPS or FedEx.

name: Jon Lynn
text: Have not gotten medication from the VA this month. Said it was delivered when it was tracked.  As for many other medicines that come in bottles.

text: This place is dark at night and not easy to find and not very customer friendly

name: Ambitious 575
text: Horrible customer service as the other reviewers have pointed out. I took a package in with a UPS label because they exchange packages with each other and I was immediately insulted. If I can find company policy on the internet why don't they know it behind the register? It is unfortunate because people in professional positions are so quick to insult people as if they're not representing a brand. The USPS is always in a financial crisis it seems.......maybe if they take a look inside they'll see why people would rather spend their money elsewhere.

name: Shaniqua Davis
text: This post office has the most rudest employees I have ever met in my life. They need to go ahead a retire this staff and start over fresh. I hate this post office with a passion.

name: Iza Elizabethh Alarcón
text: TERRIBLE WAIT TIME! I wish I could rate it 0 stars. I went to buy stamps and had to wait my whole lunch hr. What a waste of time. The gentleman was very nice but VERY SLOW. Some people left bc it was so slow. I am never going to this post office, next time I'll go to the other one by Wells Fargo and Goodwill. Also, I believe that if this post office is so slow and busy, maybe they should have 2 people working in the front.

name: Marcia Fernandes
text: Needed to overnight an envelope to Albuquerque, NM. The woman was very helpful. Told me which envelope and address label I needed.

name: sabrina taylor
text: Absolutely the worst staff ever!!!! Staff loud talk over you, and don't like to answer questions without attitude. They only thing they take time to do is get smart with you!

Never open at 8 plus The older black woman have a very Nasty attitude

Never have the same carrier, some do not even wear a uniform. Ridiculous station with lazy incompetent mail carriers.

text: The hours of this post office is 8am -4:30pm. I waited from 8:05am until 8:25 am and not one employee was there. The doors were still locked as I left the building. This is ridiculous.

name: Robbie Bradford
text: To begin , our carrier delivers mail to us that belongs to other people almost weekly. I’ve had to give packages to my neighbors myself because our carrier is so inept.  Secondly , I received a text message saying that They had attempted to deliver my package at 7:12 PM but  my text was received at 5:39 PM making it impossible for them to be telling the truth. In my opinion the carrier was just too lazy to deliver my package and insisted on me having to drive to my local post office and pick up my package. This is absolutely ridiculous.

name: Gary Harper
text: Teller was helpful had to send a money order. Always helpful.

name: Cheryl Gatlin
text: Called to ask if I could pick up my package since I will be at work when it goes out for delivery tomorrow. Simple yes or no question. Chastity/Cassidy? Something like that. Was very very very rude. I work in customer service. There is no reason whatsoever to be so rude and condescending towards someone asking you a simple question. I understand it's the holidays, believe me, I work in a large retail store, but that was just uncalled for. USPS needs to be hiring some more professional employees that know how to speak to their customers.

name: Joe and Angela Eustice
text: I put in a change of address here.They are returning all my mail as decrease unable to forward return to sender . I have been in this post office alot and they are lazy and don't know how to do there job . I'm will be calling the main office and complaining.  Guess what Im not dead 😂 .  This post office needs employee number that know how to follow directions .

name: Tim Burney
text: Good service, but still wish it was back downtown. everyone now has to drive to this location instead of being able to walk.

name: Kellie Travers
text: I have always had a pleasant time when visiting this post office. Fast and efficient staff.

text: Very rude over the phone, would not let me finish what I was asking before interrupting me and not giving me a straight answer.

text: Terrible service. They don't even try and deliver on time.  The worst.

name: Susan Ellis
text: They are such clowns.  Don't ever let Amazon send you something for Sunday delivery - they don't do their job.  They act like they either attempted it or even mark falsely as delivered.

name: Jonathan Bounds
text: Helpful her they could use some extended hours

name: John Hardin
text: 9am and no one here at the post office so I can pick up package

name: Danielle theHanyo
text: I love this place. The employees are always very helpful and we've never really had any problems with anything at all. We end up coming in fairly regularly too and mailing out a ton of mail all over the world and the closest thing to a problem was a mix up on an address to Austria (the guy thought it was supposed to go to Australia) and it took us a moment to catch it too so like... Not a big deal. We caught it in time and beyond that every time we've gone it's been a good experience. I wouldn't say fun exactly but I don't dread going there and the wait time is never over 10 minutes when they're crowded.

name: Pamela Pugh
text: I had a seller mail a package in a flat rate box and only paid for 1 ounce so additional money was due, the Postmaster Greg hand delivered me this package and did not send it back even though he could have chosen that route. I live 10 miles from post office so this shows the character that our Jasper, Alabama Postmaster has, He cares about people and our mail! Thank you GREG for your generosity and going beyond your job duties!

name: Misti Estes
text: The postal workers are very helpful. Always greet there patrons with How can I help you and Thank you at the end. Very knowledgeable of rules and regulations. Most of the office workers have worked there for several years.

name: Patti Griffith
text:
The employees are always nice and helpful. Service is very fast, usually at least three clerk's are
working at a time. You can get all
your shipping material here, nice greeting cards, gift cards to almost anything you want, and Jasper, Alabama United States
Postal always has a great
variety of postage stamps. 💯

name: A JRuck
text: They are always super friendly and keep things running. For the amount of packages I receive, I never have any problems.

name: Mecachu 64
text: Absolutely AWFUL!!! I've always taken my prepaid packages to Carbon Hill and they were sent out perfectly, Jasper's employees on the other hand came up with every excuse in the book on why they couldn't mail my package (the USPS tape can't be accepted, the box size, the label, literally anything). Today I take the same package to CH and it's mailed off with no problem, also found out the employees at Jasper LIED, there was nothing wrong with the box or the label and the tape is THE ONLY TAPE USPS CAN ACCEPT!!! Getting things mailed off at Jasper would be a lot easier if the employees would want to do their job instead of being lazy. From now on when staying in Jasper I'll just make a longer trip to CH where the employees actually know what they are doing!

name: Kiley Smith
text: Need a proper contact number and not this automated junk..been trying for over 30 minutes just to try an get a person.

name: Sandra Courington
text: Most friendly and helpful post office in our area!!

name: Kelleigh Killingsworth
text: Very helpful and sweet ladies working here. They even helped me wrap the china I was shipping when I said I was in a hurry!

name: Margaret Spears
text: JASPER POST OFFICE-Southern Hospitality At It's Best.

name: Samson Kirby
text: This is the 2nd time that my paycheck has been delivered to someone else's address!! How about hiring people who actually want to do their job!

name: Kristopher McGregor
text: This postal service is full of idiots, i have had 5 total packages lost by them, Tracked them all the way to Jasper and the Jasper Post officer either loses them or misdelivers them. 1 of them was even my Check. I hate living in a town where most elementary school kids could deliver the post more accurately than them.

name: Avis Hudson
text: The employees for the most part are very helpful and knowledgable.

name: Jessica pittman
text: Worst service I have ever received. Their mailman Bryan put down that he delivered two of our packages in a mailbox (which we do not have a mailbox) and then tries to say that he delivered it to someone at our kiosk. I've spoke to every employee and no one has received either package! Our customers are steaming mad Bc their products have not come in so I called the office and spoke to a woman named Cindy I believe which was very rude and said that she talked to a female that said she claimed that she received the part and that she thought she had misplaced it. Funny thing is is I am the only female working here and I received no calls. I asked Cindy who this persons name was and she couldn't remember apparently. She also said that Bryan said he may have dropped it off at the store beside us that he couldn't remember. I've spoke to the owner the manager and the employees and they all said that they never received our package and that none of them have received a phone call from her. I figured it may have been the mall manager so I called her, nope not her either. I asked for some kind of proof that it was delivered and they could not give me any form of proof, I asked why he documented that it was delivered to a mailbox and he was saying he delivered it to us (why is the documentation off u know) and she said oh well they sometimes accidentally push the wrong button and file it wrong. So on top of them losing two of our packages and lying to us and having false documentation they are now saying that they are not gonna reimburse us for any of our packages they have lost. And because we now have to order another product AGAIN FOR THE THIRD TIME we will now be losing money from our business, the customers are steaming mad, and they have made business very difficult and we no longer trust them. Keep in mind my owners do business for 46 franchises and they are still growing! They have agreed that we will never be using USPS again. Their service is awful and I'll be so happy to know that I will never have to deal with them again!

name: Shannon Michelle Clark
text: I had loooong help n she was grrrrrrrreat!!!!!!!

name: Tammy Campbell
text: Our mail person doesn't know or will not put our mail in right mail box.

name: Jason Latham
text: Mail carrier comes by at the same time every day

name: Jason Latham
text: Nice to know there is one out there

name: Peggy Willcutt
text: Closed. Out of business

name: Brandon Gagnon
text: Went here 2 times in a week. Once at 4 and once at 3:45 in the afternoon. It was closed both times.

name: Jolie Medina
text: Love this post ... Not a long line no waste of time!

name: Art Of Valor
text: From what I've read, the first Piedmont, Alabama post office was resurrected in the mid 1800's. This building is very old but has been remodeled and kept up well over the years. Always enjoyed the atmosphere here.

name: Krystal Moore
text:
Most of the clerk's are just fine.
Shelia ruins it for the whole post, though. She never wears her mask properly. She is ALWAYS rude and short with customers that she doesn't know or who aren't overly friendly with her. We've watched her bully and talk down to many customers over the years...she has no business working with the public.
I'm leaving a review now because things seem to be getting worse. I recently witnessed Shelia checking a customer out, and insinuating to another employee that bad things happen to some people's packages. Obviously the customers in line would assume that she was referring to the package that she was currently processing.
We have never had a problem with our delivery...just our encounters with Shelia. She should not work with the public.

name: Pam Love
text: You pay outrageous prices for 2 day service and it takes 5 days for delivery and even with that they still didnt deliver. I am noy sending anything else USPS. I could walk and deliver it in person faster. Then you go to post office for a refund only to have to stand and wait for 2 hours because the post master has left for lunch at 2p and there are not sure the postmaster is even coming back to finish the day. If you cant overnight or express mail then its quite simply take it down until you can do your jobs. While I was at the,post office several people came in to send mail express. They gladly take your money knowing they cant deliver like they are paid to do. I am very 😡 with the service I received while there the anger and smart comments were uncalled for.

name: indrid cold
text: Shelia is very rude and not cut out to work with the public. Shipping is horrible even before covid. The Post office is a waste of tax payers money imo.

name: Karen Towne
text: The two clerks ( blonde and brunette) were working when I stopped by and they were very nice. They answered my questions and helped me with my packages. Really liked the building also, pretty old but clean. Definitely will go back!

name: Terry Smart
text: There was only one clerk working up front when I went so it’s understaffed. There was a loud older lady eating at a table, while the clerk that helped me was doing everything else. However, the clerk that helped me was very friendly. I asked about the flag and a woman in the back came up and talked to me and my wife. Other than the very loud woman, it was a pleasant experience.

name: Cindy Kohl
text: I usually have good things to say about folks but the new mail carrier on my route is LACKING. My mail is left with my neighbors mail in their boxes at times. Not always, mind you, just sometimes. And Why is it that our carrier will leave 2 out of 3 packages stuffed inside our jumbo box, and take the 3rd back with him causing Amazon to notify me that the carrier COULD NOT MAKE IT TO MY DOOR to leave my package and that I must contact the carrier to track it down?? My front door is about a hundred or so yards from my  mailbox & the carrier has left packages at my front door before numerous times. However,  yesterday he could not. I called the Post Office, spoke with the supervisor on June 11, 2019, tried to find out where my package was like Amazon told me to do, and  after a brief hold was told shortly & quickly the carrier will bring my package out today and the call was disconnected. How rude.  Why was it not left yesterday with the other two packages that WERE delivered?? Were there dragons in my driveway he just could not overcome??  And for over a month now, for some reason when the carrier tries to leave my mail the door on my mailbox decides to attack and tears itself from the box and flings itself into the ditch. My husband has tried to force it to stay by installing new rivets to hold the door on the box on (2) two separate occasions. We have finally stepped up to using bolts to fasten the door to the box. We sincerely hope this will stop our wayward mailbox from acting so rudely to our mail carrier. Hopefully this will help encourage our carrier to know we care about our mail and packages and appreciate him doing the same. He can leave our packages at our door anytime. 😊

name: Donna Hill
text: Every time I have been in this post office or my granddaughter the lady is very rude & ugly. It’s a shame to go in for something & be treated so rude. If you work with the public you should be nicer. I think that old lady needs to retire or get a job that’s nit around the public. We the customers don’t deserve to be treated so ugly.

name: Bobbie Garrett
text: Left my package leaning against the tree down the road!  UNACCEPTABLE!!!!

name: Ashley Delevie
text: Very rude ppl..I have to chase the mailman down BC he never leaves my packages. When I call they say deal with it and refuse to contact the mailman. This is 8 times straight today...4 packages out for delivery and not the first one got left. I'm seriously thinking about contacting my lawyer and pursuing the matter.

name: Matt Jennings
text: Staff is rude, and they ALWAYS close up 3 to 5 minutes early.

name: Tracey Delevie
text: Never ever ever get my package delivered like it says when I track today 6 emails saying different times..what is your problem USPS.

name: April Ford
text: Everything I have ever had to go in and deal with anyone, they have always been super rude from the get go then they act like they really don't want to speak to you, and they typically hassle you about your business

name: James Richburg
text: Why would the postmaster return a letter to a business on Main Street instead of putting it in their PO Box. Very unfriendly to a local business and gives a poor impression of the postal operation in Columbia.

name: Nathon Roden
text: Another ups, it is horrible too

name: Christy Vaughn
text: Great place to drop of UPS pagages sold on mecari!

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Nathon Roden
text: Its ups, horrible

name: Mediocre Photography
text: Off and on service.  Most times it is quick and easy drop offs for me.  One time I was told I had to buy the tape to tape my package up (they had always taped it for me).. So I bought an entire roll of package tape just for that one instance.  Most times the employees are friendly and helpful... But there is a young girl there that isn't friendly and gives one the sense of rudeness just in her lack of personality.  Oh well, thanks to Amazon's new set up that allows me to drop things off without a label, my experiences have been good ones.  🤗

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback! We definitely always want to try to have a smile on our faces when our customers walk through the door. Several new employees have started recently for the holiday rush so we apologize if you've experienced anything at all negative or unpleasant. We will be sure to remind all of our employees to keep a positive attitude towards everyone who walks into our store. Thank you!

name: Nathon Roden
text: I have no idea how ups is in other parts of the country but when it hits ft.payne it is the absolute worst shipping company ever. Swear they don't update tracking there 70% of the time. They constantly miss "scheduled delivery time" its so bad I've convinced my company to no longer use them and instead we ship FedEx. I swear I wish Amazon would make FedEx an option.

name: Jess Medley
text:
I had a package sent to Colorado that was time sensitive. I was assured it would be fine and to just let them take care of it. The package ended up getting lost, spent almost a month trying “to locate it”, and then redeliver to the correct address. The people that work at this location do not seem very knowledgeable about their jobs and were of no help, and very rude at that! The shipment was ruined by the time it was actually delivered and when I contacted them to see if I could at least get my money back for the shipping, or anything for that matter, they were extremely rude.
I recommend USPS or The Package Store! Anywhere but here!

name: Mariah Keith
text:
Unexceptable customer service!
Rude seasoned employee and improperly trained "new" one.  Listed as an Amazon no print return drop off facility however they are unable to scan the Amazon generated return label and want to charge you $2.33 for another. Waited for 10+ minutes for them to receive the label that was sent directly to their verified email twice. Asked about alternative options - none. Walked out and took the package to the local "Package Store" in and out in under 2 minutes free off charge.

name: david walker
text: The folks working there were friendly enough.  But I took a file by on Friday afternoon to be printed in book form on better paper stock than normal bond.  This is for an instructional manual for my office.  The printing is fine.  But when I got it back to my office and tried to add it to my 3-ring binder, the holes they punched would not work.  They're not standard.  On top of that, they punched the last 3 chapters and the index completely backwards.  My last time to use The UPS Store for anything.

resp.text: Mr. Walker, thank you for bringing this to our attention.  I am sorry that we did not do a good job.  If you will, let us reprint and punch the holes properly.  We checked the hole puncher and did find it out of adjustment.  It has been fixed.  We are sorry that this has happened.  Thank You.

name: Screw Rti
text: I ordered something that was expensive. My time frame window was between 9-1pm. I have stated home all day to insure the package was not left out too long due to I live in apartments. It’s nearly 5 and the package has not been delivered. These guys really need to stick to there quotes they give people. I’ve wasted my whole day waiting. I will not be using this service again if I can help it.

name: SHARRON “SHERRIE” BANNISTER
text:
I dont recommend this business, I was over charged, given terrible quality photos and was expected to keep.  She refused to make it right, would not give refund.  I wish I could show a picture of the items that I was charged for.

Update:
The owner contacted me and offered a complete refund.   I really appreciate that he was kind and understanding.   He asked for a copy to show the employees at that location the errors that were made.  I believe Larry is an honest business man and he deserves another chance.

resp.text:
Dear Sharron Bannister,

Firstly, we’d like to extend our most sincere condolences on the loss of your loved one. We can’t begin to know exactly what you're dealing with, and we extend our thoughts and prayers to you and your family during this trying time.

Concerning the event in question, we’re both sorry and surprised to hear of the negative experience you had at our store. As we all know, everyone has their own unique take on any given situation, and we’d just like to briefly give ours, so that we are all on the same page. When we assisted the customer on the day in question, we had the customer review and approve the print before moving forward. We do this to ensure that all of our customers are satisfied with the quality before we start running the job, as once we’ve begun, we cannot make adjustments and have already begun incurring costs.

In this case, seeing as the customer reviewed and approved a proof, we simply did not know there was even a concern until your family began leaving several reviews, all of which tell a different story than what we experienced, and candidly, we understand. This is a difficult time for all, and we can absolutely understand how difficult of a time this must be. We're dedicated to not only provided excellent products with equally excellent service, but we’re committed to being a part of the community, and we would never ask a customer to accept a product they weren’t happy with. Had we known there were issues with the prints prior to customer approval, or with the finished product when they were reviewed when you returned to pick them up, we would have done and will do everything possible to rectify this for you, and we’re committed to doing so again in the future.

Your feedback is important to us, and it doesn’t fall on deaf ears.
Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Bo Doeg
text: Only use this location if it is last ditch, while the atmosphere was comfortable and quiet the only thing these folks are interested in is how fast they can take your money. The young lady working the counter was rude and completely unhelpful. She had an air if disdain when I asked any questions as if it was just too much to bear. I asked for a next day shipment and was given a regular label. When I asked she just told me that I was doing ok. When I finished the label o asked if that was all I needed to do to get next day shipping, she got upset that I hadn't made it clear I wanted next day shipping. I clearly asked twice for a next day label. Over all I would use the USPS from now on, it is a small wonder that anything gets shipped from this location. This UPS store had garbage service. Customers BEWARE!

name: Logan LeGrande
text: Overpriced and management is rude to employees

name: Kevin Adams
text: So very sad that people choose to make money wrongfully, off the death of others family members. My sisters and I Went to the UPS store in Fort Payne to have some obituary cards printed of our deceased parents, the lady at the counter only let me print one copy and then made copies of that making all but the original very poor quality. On one family members cards the owner mistakenly forgot to turn the paper and double printed over the first copy making it completely impossible to read, but laminated over it anyway and charged me for the unreadable copy. Even worse blamed me for the error even though she was the only one with access to the printer which was behind the counter. Great way to run a business, blaming the customer for your error and even worse selling a product that was meant to be a gift that can’t even be read. When my sister took the cards back to the store the owner refused to try to make it up or even give a  refund while screaming and insulting my sister. A very expensive lesson since we were over charged to begin with and still are without the obituary cards. This is a very dishonest way of doing business, not worthy of anyone’s business. We will never do business with that store again.

resp.text:
Dear Kevin Adams,

Firstly, we’d like to extend our most sincere condolences on the loss of your loved one. We can’t begin to know exactly what you're dealing with, and we extend our thoughts and prayers to you and your family during this trying time.

Concerning the event in question, we’re both sorry and surprised to hear of the negative experience you had at our store. As we all know, everyone has their own unique take on any given situation, and we’d just like to briefly give ours, so that we are all on the same page. When we assisted the customer on the day in question, we had the customer review and approve the print before moving forward. We do this to ensure that all of our customers are satisfied with the quality before we start running the job, as once we’ve begun, we cannot make adjustments and have already begun incurring costs.

In this case, seeing as the customer reviewed and approved a proof, we simply did not know there was even a concern until your family began leaving several reviews, all of which tell a different story than what we experienced, and candidly, we understand. This is a difficult time for all, and we can absolutely understand how difficult of a time this must be. We're dedicated to not only provided excellent products with equally excellent service, but we’re committed to being a part of the community, and we would never ask a customer to accept a product they weren’t happy with. Had we known there were issues with the prints prior to customer approval, or with the finished product when they were reviewed when you returned to pick them up, we would have done and will do everything possible to rectify this for you, and we’re committed to doing so again in the future.

Your feedback is important to us, and it doesn’t fall on deaf ears.
Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Wendy Rosen
text: This UPS Store is the most hatefully, rude, disrespectful bunch of inexperienced kids I have ever seen in a franchised store. I deal with the local Authorized Shipping Center call "The Package Store" they are the best and very smart and knowledgeable people, they can ship "UPS", "FedEx". "DHL" and "USPS" giving customers more options instead of just one choice.

name: Warrior4truth
text: I was charged 2.50 for one copy of paper and no computer use. I sent my page via email to their computer and the foreign lady was rude and of absolutely no use or help to explain why. We will no longer use this location.

resp.text:
Being a small veteran owned business we do have to charge for our services.  We used our computer to retrieve your email, opening your file and printing your document.  These are the items that went into the $2.50 charge to get you your document.

Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Rica Turner
text: I just went in the post office around 20 minutes ago, and the lady working the front desk was extremely rude. Now I stood in line and watched her give everyone else man that they haven’t received due to it getting sent back, but when it was my turn she was very rude. I told her that my check supposed to been mailed to my address on the 26th so told me no it said they’ll go out on the 26th now remind you it’s customers in the lobby. I asked if she could check she told me no and that they haven’t gotten any checks today and I said well I just wanted to be sure she said like I said it don’t suppose to come to your house on the 26 it get mailed out I told her she wasn’t the IRS she got smart and started something as I walking out but that was very unprofessional.

I agree the person deserves their lunch hour, but closing for lunch is BS in my opinion. Someone other than one person should be able to mail a package, rather than having to come back at their connivence. Change your business hours if your not going to let anyone in, especially if their there before “closing time”.

I have chased her down 3 times and given her the mail. Numerous times (including today) I find a note that nobody was home when we have been sitting by the door waiting for package. Very typical government agency. If you want good service the guy in Southside Pharmacy goes way above and beyond to help you.

The one in fultondale take their jobs way to “serious” they always would let me use their tape if I need it and this past time when I asked for tape the responds was “we sell it” told the lady they let me use the tape here in the past, didn’t seem like she cared. text: I love my post office. You never know what you will get there. It can be junk mail, a bill  or a hand written letter or a nice card. YES THEY STILL DO SEND THOSE AND THEY ARE MORE PERSONAL THAN SOMETHING ELECTRONIC!!! The personal touch always wins hands down every time!! So bite me IBM and Apple and any other computer or smart phone.

name: katherine bagley

text: I was staying on an RV park near here and I had to send a package and this was the only near official USPS office. My impression was that if you are not a local your first contact will be "dry". but after they see that you are a respectful person will treat you the same way. I felt in love with Arley. Office was clean and my package started moving quick after I drop it. THANKS

text: When I come to this post office, you don't get a warm welcome. It's like your a nuisance, your bothering them. Even worse when you call. I've called a couple of times to get a question answered or check on a package ( different times of the day), i get a rude response. Most of the time, he tells me he is busy and can't help, he's the only one....or call back in an hour or so.. or just get on the internet. I avoid this place at all cost. I wouldn't even rate it one star actually but I'm a nice person.

name: Jason Welsh
text: Love this post office, the post master is so friendly and the mail is always on time. You can’t ask for a better post office.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Easy in/out, helpful people. Not the cleanest inside, but typical government condition probably. Never have ADA-compliant lower counter open, instead use it for storage, so a person in a wheelchair has to struggle. Real nice about offering to help carry packages though. $70/year for a small, regular mail box.

name: Katie D
text: Very nice staff! Was in and out fast. Will definitly use them again!!

name: Jesse Hays
text: Abismal service I could not imagine worse. I was out of the house a few days and missed a signing for a usps package, so they dropped it off at Satsuma. They apparently only hold packages for 2 days:(.... This is why the government shouldn't run anything the satsuma post office would make a great example. I'm currently chasing that package all over creation, it was supposed to be gift about 2 weeks ago:/......

name: Dominique Vannetzel

Lies on lies.

name: Kayla Shannon
text: I got a notice saying 2 packages were to be delivered. I got one package around 4pm, but no second package. At 6:45 I recieved a text saying they didn't have access to my front door so they could t deliver my package. Which is a lie because how could they deliver the first one to being with? If your drivers make a mistake, own the mistake. Don't put it on me, ESPECIALLY when I make sure to stay on top of things like tracking a package when it contains gifts. So thank you for messing around with my anniversary and Easter presents. But if your driver is too lazy to make a second trip cuz they made a mistake the first time, that is on the driver, and USPS, NOT the home dweller.

text: Been trying to get hold of local post office for a week. Keep getting the 800 number and they have no connection for my proble

name: Kathy I
text: I'm happy that I ventured into this business. They are an exceptional group of employees. Eager to help you with your packages and what ever else you are looking for. I recommend this store for all of your shipping needs and copying. Thank you UPS for becoming my new, to go to place.

name: Kimberly Clark
text: Finally a place that understands awesome customer service will bring people back!  Each time I’ve went in or called they have went above and beyond!  Today it was Dominic York with great packaging suggestions for my odd shaped  mail item.  A few weeks ago it was Louis Huluska taking time during the busy Christmas season to help me.  I no longer go anywhere else and tell all my friends to do their mailing here. Wonderful staff!

text:
the completely inept desk clerk said she couldn’t look up ups account and she was provided my corporate account number and contact info and she still made the excuse they are just a franchise.  i will use fedex next time. i even sent them a pic of my preprinted ups shipping label with account and name preprinted. duh
is it just alabama iq?

name: Matt MacKay
text: I’m in Nevada and they’re in Alabama trying to ship four paintings. They were super friendly and helpful providing a quote— and much more affordable and timely than the moving company. Louis was especially helpful! He followed up consistently with tracking numbers and packaged the paintings so securely. I was extremely pleased with how quickly they came and the condition they arrived in for the price.

name: Joanna L
text: I had some returns to Amazon and Old Navy. Super easy and fast. I was greeted pretty much as soon as I entered the store and assisted quickly.

name: Ramiro Santiago
text: Not crowded and people are wearing masks and keeping distance. Store is clean and aisles are roomy.

name: Carol Laney
text: I needed help sending a 24 x 36 painting and they were so helpful. I received a call from my family and they received it with no problems. They bragged on how well it was packed. Thank you UPS!

name: Heather James
text: I went to The Ups Store of Enterprise this morning and the two young ladies open the store like 10 minutes early so could ship my packages to my elderly mother and family for Christmas, thank you ladies for assisting me and making my holiday shipment less stressful. I was in and out the store quickly. I believe her name was Alexis she had a pleasant smile, great hospitality and exceptional customer service skills her co- worker (I do not know her name), she was very pleasant as well. You all have a great staff! I will be back soon.

name: Kitty Keener
text: Always fast and helpful service! Very clean inside which is important during these times.

name: Garrett T
text: Louis and Alexis were extremely helpful and had a pleasantly cheerful demeanor.  I went in the store on a mission to get a card blown up to a bigger size, and was unsure of the precise size that I needed. They willingly took the time and walked me through the sizes he demonstrated and helped me arrive to a decision.  I will always do business with them now.  Thank you!!!

name: Vibity 360
text: Great customer service! Every visit I am welcomed by a friendly staff member who is happy to help. I recently had some Christmas cards printed and they turned out perfect. Their manager and notary public is extremely knowledgeable and professional. Thank you UPS Enterprise.

resp.text:
Hi Vibity 360,

We are incredibly grateful that you took the time out to leave us this note. Our company values put customer satisfaction as top priority and we are committed to our customers. Its customers like you that make our job wonderful. We look forward to serving you again.

Thank you,
The UPS Store 6732
334-417-0051

text:
The reason I’m leaving 3 star review is because of the price of the boxes. We needed one large box and the box cost $14. We couldn’t even believe it. The return was already paid for so it was $14 for just the box. Definitely make sure you buy your box elsewhere and then use their services.
•The actual service is great and the people are kind and handle your service quickly.

text:
Well the upped the price to print shipping labels to $2.50. I walked in and out the UPS door today 3 times to get a box shipped.
I expected to pay for it but not that much.
Everything being severely overpriced is going to run off business. I will figure out another way to access UPS for shipping.
Walmart and lowes both sell boxes.

text: i will give negative 10 if i could. I needed to return amazon prime  order they tried to charge 2.25$ for print label. I left my wallet at home asked if possible to avoid charge this time they say no! very greedy people works there

text: They really shouldn't advertise notary. I took a paper in and was told to take it to the dothan store because "she didn't like to notarize without the other notary" why be a notary? In all honesty, she done it for my husband but said no to me. Seems sexist to me.

name: Ben Solo
text: This location advertises that they have a notary. The guy I talked to refused to notarize my document. He said he was “uncomfortable because he had not finished his training”. Are you a notary or not? He seemed pretty dense. What a joke. Thank you for wasting my time. FWIW the loan office in the same strip mall will notarize a document without giving you some lame excuse.

resp.text:
Dear Ben Solo,
We want to sincerely apologize for your negative experience in our store. However, we'd like to learn more about your situation and what exactly happened. We want to make things right. So, please give us a call on 334-417-0051. You can also email us at store6732@theupsstore.com and we will get back to you promptly. We look forward to hearing from you and earning you back your business.

name: Lucy Johnson
text: The staff is so professional and friendly. I absolutely love the family atmosphere that i feel every time when i go to drop items off for my job. The store manger Mr.Wade is a true example of a rare gem..God bless this whole staff..Candlewood Suite's Staff loves ya!!

name: Miguel Castaneda

text:
The owner was more than helpful! The entire staff was very friendly! I needed help with a mailing box and was quite overwhelmed about my options. He listened and walked me through my options step-by-step.  Huge relief!
I am so happy they are in Enterprise because I was afraid that I would have to drive to Dothan.  I will be using them instead of the Post Office for everything now!

Good Afternoon Chip Sahoy,
On behalf of all of us at The UPS Store #6732, I would like to thank you for sharing this great review about our store! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your experience with us at The UPS Store Enterprise. We will be sharing your feedback amongst our team. please come visit us again soon!

name: Kahlin Mongrello
text: Super nice and so helpful. I didn't even have tape or a correct box and he supplied both for me without any cost and took care of everything for me.

text:
Place is a joke. I went in to print a 3 page document from email and have it scanned back. Also to mail 2 envelopes. P. Chez did NOT know what she was doing. name: Georgia Ford
text: Today one of your men delivered 2 boxes to my house 87 Bryan Ct. Dora, AL.  I am in a wheel chair and it takes me a bit to answer the door.  It was pouring down rain and he banged on the door and left the boxes on the porch in the rain and ran back to his truck.  By the time I got to the door and got it opened he was driving off.  This was the worst possible thing he could have done.  I am not happy.

resp.text: I sincerely apologize for the inadequate service.  We, however, at The UPS Store, have nothing to do with drivers or deliveries.  We are a Franchise of UPS, and have Retail establishments only.  The best possible thing that you can do, is to call UPS Customer Service and explain your situation.  They will be more than happy to message the hub in Birmingham, where this driver comes from, and let them know of your circumstances, so that this won't happen again.  Although we actually had nothing to do with this delivery, here at The UPS Store, along with UPS, value your business and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  We will pass it along to UPS so they can deal with it accordingly.  Their phone number is 1-800-742-5877.  It is a voice prompt system, so if you'll simply say, "Missed delivery" a few times, it will pass you along to a live operator.  Thank you again for your business and if we can help you in any way at The UPS Store in Jasper, we'll be more than happy to do so.  Jeff Graham, Owner

name: Anthony Kimbrell
text: They have definitely  been able to take care of any of the business or shipping needs I have faced...and have accomplished it flawlessly.

text: Love 30+ minute wait times when you're the ONLY person in the store? Incompetence? An army of octogenarians who can't get out of their own way? This is the place for you! Every time I go here, which is only to ship something next day air out of desperation, I swear it's the LAST TIME. You'd be better off WALKING your package to its destination.

resp.text: We never have more than a 10 minute wait in our store. Complex print jobs do sometimes take longer, but there are always 2 or more employees and we pride ourselves on our quick and competent customer service. I'm sorry that you had a bad experience and we'd love to have the chance to make it right. I've owned this store for over 15 years now, and wouldn't be here without the strength of my staff, the ability to solve problems, and the great customers that come into my store time and time again.

name: Kirk Maddox
text:
Don't trust that your packages will be scanned so they can be tracked.

Many times the substitute drivers do not scan the packages I send to my Ebay customers,,, I have complained so many times in person and calls and emails.. I have been informed more than once that drivers would be trained and reprimanded and their actions corrected but that has either not happened or has already been forgotten.
If you have a package whose tracking information must be shared with a customer, be sure to go through the inconvenience of driving the package down to this post office in person so you can get a receipt after the scan it at the desk.  We  have never had an issue with our regular route driver.
Do not trust these critical packages to any sub drivers who are supposed to scan every package the second they pick them up from your mailbox...

name: Randy Lee
text:
I use this post office a couple times a week for business and personal purposes. I wanted to take a moment to just say THANK YOU to all of the postal workers here - especially PEGGY - who is usually manning the front desk when I visit. Peggy is always gracious, helpful and professional. I truly appreciate her taking the time to treat me like a customer. I can tell she enjoys her job and makes the most of her interactions with the public. I know it is easy to forget when people do their job well, because that is what we expect - but I just wanted to pause and say thanks Peggy for caring. I hope God blesses you... and maybe your bosses too. You deserve it.
-Randy Lee
Middle Man Enterprises
Host of the Flipping Genius podcast

Items such as appliances and fragile items require specific packaging to ensure that all packages arrive in both a timely and safe manner. We do apologize if you felt that our prices were too high or costly. Please feel free to contact us here at the store to resolve any issues you experienced during your visit.

Thank you,
Management

Occasionally, on my day off, I've used the one in Foley because it's closer to my home. The one in Foley is twice as expensive in my experience. I asked them to download 1 sheet of paper and print it so I Could sign it. Then have them scan it into a pdf and email it to me. Foley price $14, Gulf Shores $6.50. You judge.

name: Celeste Griffin
text: I visited this UPS store on 10/28/19 and the customer service was very poor.  The lady that took my package had walked past the counter and me to put something on a shelf. She stretched out her arms to take my package, she did not greet me or ask me if she could help me.  It wasn't until I asked a question that she spoke to me. I didn't get her name, but she has long brown hair.  I will never use this store again.

name: Charlene M.
text: The young lady who was running the store today was incredible! Madison I think. The line was to the door and she was all by herself. By the time i got to the counter she still greeted me with a smile and helped me get done shipping my package fast. I don't like doing reviews but i felt this girl needed recognition for how she handled a very busy store and how she treated customers. I witnessed a guy snatch a package out of her hands and she nearly went over the counter. I feel there needs to be more than one person there at a time to make sure the employees are safe. If she was alone i'm sure she would have been scared.

name: tricia bankston
text: Excellent service.

name: Braf Ong
text: I normally dont review stores, but it this case I have to!  I walked into the ups store and felt like I was a priority. There was several people in line and a older woman at the register automatically looked up and welcomed me to the store. I didnt have to wait very long, but she still apologized for the wait. She seemed so sincere! She was very talkative and friendly and acted as if she really enjoyed her job and people.  This kind of service should be everywhere. I definitely will be back . My receipt has Angela on it! Thanks again for the excellent customer service

name: lisa jon UN umes
text: I used ups to make copies. I drop off my copies to be single copy. The employee asked when I would like them. I said as soon as I was ready. The next day I sent someone to pick them up and she was told they won't be ready until sometime Monday, which was fine. But then I get a voicemail like two hours later on Thursday that they are ready. So I sent that same person to pick them up and pay $138.00. I then went over the copies about 400 was single copy, the rest was double copy which was over 1400. I had to separate the papers myself, which I was told by a co-worker they do that.I tired for a week to talk to someone about my order. When I finely did that same person who made my copy told me that I didn't say single and if I want to have them redo I will have to pay again. She pretty much blame me the customer because she didn't hear me. There was no form of any kind for me to fill out leave my instruction. Since she was the manager I ask to speak to the owner. She told me a time but when I called he was not their, I been trying to get ahold of him for a couple of days. I will not be using their service again, ever through they did give me a discount rate since these copies were for my class. I was always told the customer was always right from working in retail before.

name: Zilla 11 (Bheast)
text: Scheduled to have notary service.  Went to appointment and they said they didn't have appointments for notary even though sign on wall says notary services appointments available.

name: Yolanda M
text: Angela at this location stole my package which contained a cell phone. She sent me an email stating she picked it up and needed more info. When I called back she changed her name to Angel and said she doesn't remember the email. I started I could send it to her. She just played dumb after that saying I don't know what you mean. Don't trust them.  Angela stated it was a franchise location they don't have the same guidelines as a corporate location. She said after 48 hours they give the packages away but she doesn't remember if that is what happened to me. Just crazy!

name: Connie Hastings
text: I used to work there (PT as neeed) till the owners sold out. The new owners have put a manager in there that doesn't know his but hole from a hole in the ground. They have jacked the prices up. I have customers and Mailbox holders trying to personally contact me at my Fulltime job, trying to get in touch with me or my daughter. (Who also no longer works there) To complain and figure out why their mail is not being sent to them. I am having to tell them We no longer work there. Good luck with that! I am willing to bet they lose A ton of customers we worked hard to get back. Especially after Amy ran it into the ground. (That was 3 owners back)

name: Amanda Koehler
text: I have nothing but good things to say about this place. The manager is very helpful and if he doesnt know the answer to my hard questions he brings up the subject at the weekly meeting. I have dealt with many of the employees at this location and they all have been super nice and helpful.  I always get my faxes and notarizations done quickly.  Keep up the good work. This store is vital to our community.

name: Jennifer Beckworth
text: I didn't feel well, but the girl helped make everything easy and got me taken care of quickly.

name: Freddy Johnson
text: MULTIPLE times I have been waiting for the doors to open at 7:30 am and NOBODY was there. I've waited until 8:30 almost 9 when someone shows up to ask if I could get a notary only to be told they wont be there till 11am.. I came back at 11 and she says they wont be there until 1pm!! I will not be returning. This is a joke.

name: Jim Buckley
text: Had a large package to ship item sold on eBay..had problems at home trying to print shipping label..employee went well above normal assistance to help me resolve issues..will definitely continue to use this location. Fantastic customer service!

name: Mike Boan
text: Price is way too. Over charge compared to others.

name: Evie Byrd
