text: Had several items shipped to my location. 3 items delivered the 4th item is now marked "attempted delivery, could not access location".

name: Chris Edwards
text: Employees suck, lack of knowledge and helpfulness

name: Linda Lemoine
text:
I usually use UPS but for some reason I decided to drive further and use the USPS. I was treated in such a rude manner by "Ron" . Never having experience with packaging he not only would not give me a little help when I asked for it, he told me "customers are supposed to do their own packing". He handed me a heavy tool that dispenses tape and pointed to the area where labels,etc. are. I was the only customer in the store mind you, until another lady came in who offered me help and then I was able to finish my process.
I have never been in a situation where someone refused to help me.
No wonder this office has such a poor rating.
I hope he gets untreatable diarrhea .

name: Trac Vo
text: Never pick up their phone.

name: Katie Vann
text: Everyone was so helpful! Danny thank you for your time and help! Best experience in a post office ever!

name: J Enis
text: Horrible! The mail delivery person left a letter in my mailbox stating they had missed me and that my certified package would be delivered back to the post office. The delivery person did not attempt to knock on my door, ring my doorbell or even blow the horn to alert me they were outside. I tried to call the post office once I received the notification to which I received a message that the hold time would be greater than one hour. Today I went to pick up my package at the post office. I was the first person there out of six people ( I was the last of the six people to leave. Four of the six people had complaints. )The guy took my notification and returned 20 minutes later to tell me there was not a package for me there. Obviously there is a package because I am holding the notification in my hand that was left in my mailbox Saturday. He alerted the Post Master and after 45 minutes of waiting for my package I finally had it in hand. Unorganized...not to mention all the many times the mail delivery person leaves a neighbors mail in my box or vice versa. We are always having to deliver each others mail to one another in my neighborhood.

name: Chris Wilson
text: Usually a long wait, then get treated rudely by postal worker. Hate going there.

name: Megan Templeton
text: Staff always looks depressed and are rude . The packages are thrown around. Observed the staff mocking two customers today. Save yourself the trouble and go to the Helena or Hoover post office - worth the drive.

name: Barbara Williams
text: Misdelivered or missing mail at least once a week. Call the post office & get hung up on.

name: K Smith
text: They frequently misdeliver my mail to other addresses or fail to deliver it at all. The most recent nonsense is failure to deliver a package with the tracking code "No access." Really? A standard residential street address with no access just one day out of the year? Absurd. Some research indicates that's the code used for "it was raining" (it was) or "I didn't want to get out of the truck" or any other reason they have for skipping a delivery, or perhaps later realizing they forgot something. At least this time there was a code. Normally there's no explanation at all. I've lived in many places, and this post office is the worst I've ever experienced.

name: Joey Smith
text: Too bad we can't give negative stars. The "lady" who helped me was the poster child for snarky attitude. Now they have lost another package that has been showing "out for delivery" for 7 days. I didn't realize we still had postal riders on horseback, hell you could walk to our house and back to the post office in less than 1/2 a day. Pathetic, no wonder they are losing money.

name: taylor evans
text: Nice place! I love it good service

name: Brittany C.
text: Easily the worst post office I have ever had dealings with. Packages aren't delivered, they are delivered to the wrong address, etc.

name: Stephanie Young
text: This is the most rude and unprofessional so called post office! You have a problem about receiving your mail or other issues,  and they do not care about resolving anything! They will hang up on you rather than to deal with you. They can't get anything right. I believe some of them can't even read or write! Pathetic

name: smile dog ace dog
text: Only delivered box 2out of 2 and lost box 1 out of 2 . Mail person said they would return the next day with it and didn’t show up.

name: Joshua Jones
text: Danny was awesome, great experience!

name: Gerald Seaborn
text: Instead of walking my package to the front door of my home which is covered, they would rather leave it on the top step which is only a few steps from my door. The package got rained on and was open. This not the first time either. Their mail carriers suck!

name: Bill Hart
text: It's the government at its BEST!

name: Dawn Marie
text:
Worst post office I've ever been to.  POOR customer service.  Nobody EVER answers the phone.
Carrier service is rediculous!

name: Joshua Williams
text: LOCAL PO I USE....STAFF IS KIND....STAYS BUSY

name: Alcides Palacios
text: Good service

name: Darren Morten
text: These people are rude! Beware if you have to go here. Customer service is a foreign concept to these people.

name: Barbie
text: This is the most worse and unprofessional post office

name: janitorial-engineer
text: They act as if it's a free service.

name: Robert Evans
text: You can tell these are government run

name: Richard Walton
text: awful

name: Jose Bracamontes
text: Terrible

name: Phillip Brewer
text: The reviews this place gets are pretty bad, but all of my experiences have been positive. The ladies that helped were good natured and friendly. In my experience if you treat people with kindness and respect you'll be more likely to get it in return. The people who work here are no different.

name: Terrell Washam
text: THEY WERE SO RUDE AND THE BLACK LADY UP THERE HAS VERY LOW DOWN WITH VERY POOR COUSTOMER EXPIRENCE IF U GONNA WORK IN THE PUBLIC THEM I FEEL AS IF U NEED NOT TO BE SO RUDE JUST SAD

name: S B
text: Worst post office in Mobile. Filled out a change of address form. Says it was being rerouted to new address but still was delivered at old one. The lady at the counter is rude af. I wouldn't advise a dog to do service with this place.

name: Trellanee Rose
text: The people how work inside the office have the absolute nastiest attitudes. They are of no help and extremely unprofessional. I spoke with a woman how said she was the supervisor about some missing packages of which there are a lot. She basically told me f u In so many words and that I should have told the companies my new address so it’s my fault. Then I asked if I could speak with someone else. She asked me way I need to talk to someone else because they would just tell me the same thing she did. I told her because I was becoming frustrated with her. I asked if there was a A corporate number or a higher office of some kind she told me no. I later came home and found the number with a google search. This post office is full of bs. I absolutely hate that I moved this area code .

name: Brian Gavan
text: DO NOT TRUST THIS POST OFFICE! WEDDING RING “MISSING” OR LIKELY STOLEN BY EMPLOYEE! 907 Spring Hill Ave, Mobile, AL 36604.  You hate to think the worst, and you would hope to god you could trust the US Postal Service, but this situation screams of scandal.  A few weeks ago On June 26th 2020 we were sending my fiancés wedding ring back to Arizona to be fixed.  It was a family heirloom given to me by my now deceased grandmother to give to my wife. Of course this is the type of item which cannot be replaced by “insurance” money.  The clerk knew the value, as when I asked that the package be sent by certified mail she said she had no forms and no supervisor. It has now been 3 weeks and the ring has not made it to its final destination. When using the tracking number supplied, it appears that the package never left Mobile. I have since gone to 2 other postal locations in an attempt to get assistance with tracking the package. Coincidence is hard to believe at this point.  Customer service will now not return my phone calls, the case made online is being ignored.  When going down to the post office in person I am met with hostility and aggression, not only at this location but at 250 St Joseph St, Mobile, AL 36601 as well. This is awful, we are torn apart by this and the post office has done nothing.

name: Dree Drum
text:
Leinkauf area Delivery Drivers Not Doing there Job
Here is Day 3 and My Package has yet another delivery Exception for the 3rd day now, everytime i go into office front desk tells me its on  the truck for redelivery ive always gotten my mail delivered around 3-4 pm deliver time has more than doubled lately see drivers sitting and chilling on there cellphones quite a few times....Peoples Packages are of importance

name: NiShawndra Henderson
text: I would appreciate mail carriers being more cautious AND abiding by traffic laws. Everyday, mail carriers in small vehicles and vans run stop signs and speed down Old Shell Rd. from the Springhill Ave location

name: Winston franks
text: On Tuesday June 2nd we were supposed to get a package but we did not get it the mail person claims that we got the package but we didn't we have informed delivery so we get notice of when we have mail coming and also packages so I made a complaint then I got an email so when saying that we got the package and it someone stole it and no one stole it from from the porch it should have been in the mailbox and the mailbox has a lock on now that means that they put it in someone else's mailbox then on Monday June 15th my mother was supposed to get Aiden letter from her church and it did not come I don't know what they're doing at their mailbox and how they keep misplacing mail or losing it I would rate them a zero if I could they are one of the worst post office about 2 months ago I had an issue with the mail lady she had a nasty attitude there's nothing had been done to her about it and apparently I cannot go to the mailbox because she claims she will not come if I go to the mailbox

name: Ann Vanderhart
text: I have lived in 4 States and the service and mail delivery from this Post Office  has been the absolute worst. Some days no delivery at all.  One Postal Person said our route did not have a dedicated carrier, so others had to pick up the slack.  And at times there was no one.

name: Bo Tucker
text: The line is usually pretty small, but there is typically only one person behind the counter. Dropping off prepaid packages is easy and quick because of close parking.

name: Tasha
text: Rude rude rude. Also, I went up there at 5:30 the other morning and the doors were locked.

name: D Nicole Lambert
text:
I believe the postal service has found a new way to get over on the consumers. If your postal inspector general says that your mail is not considered "mail" until it has been scanned into the office, but your postal clerks REFUSE to give consumers proof that they submitted a package, it means that the postal service does not have to pay claims to people when they lose their packages, because there is no way to prove that the package was even received by the post office. I think this is a way for the post office to get away with theft and neglect. This is the second time that I have taken my package into a post office and was told that I could not have a receipt. I have not received confirmation that my package was scanned. My last package was stolen and I was informed that I couldn't submit a claim because they never scanned my package in. So even though the clerk told me to leave it there, it ended up being my fault for leaving it, and the post office would not pull the film unless it was a threat. So I lost my money and items, and received a big fat F you from the post office. I know I walked into that office with three packages, and left with none. And my package was never found. The post office is wrong for this and this is exactly why you are loosing money.

Update...they did it again! I ordered boxes from the post office...online because you can get them FREE!!! Why did I go into the post office and the lady at the front desk attempted to CHARGE me for the box?!!!! Then said that she wasn’t going to ship my package unless I paid. I said lady you can’t charge me for a box I brought in myself!!!

name: Reese Barron
text: This post office is HORRIBLE!!!!!I went in to pick up a package and the lady I was talking to was acting all nonchalant and eating the whole time she was talking to me. And acted like she didn't want to go look for package. But thank goodness there was another worker there who overheard the conversation and went to go look for it.

name: Ray Spratlin
text:
Always have the worst experience at this location. I order online a lot and some packages eventually have to go through USPS. The delivery driver for my area is lazy, and will not get out of the truck to deliver packages. Sometimes they won't even put a notice in my mailbox that the package is being held at a nerby center, which is always this one sadly. They constantly lose mail and packages, and flat out refuse to help when looking for items when I go in. The worst incident happened between 3-12-19 and 3-14-19. Had a phone case from ottorbox sent through  FedEx, and they handed it off to USPS for residential delivery. My tracking # through FedEx said package was undelivered due to incorrect address. Blatant lie from USPS. When to this USPS center to try and retrieve my package. They woman at the customer service desk argued with me I had no package there. When asked to confirm my tracking number, they told me they were "unauthorized to release the package" even though I had several forms of prof it was mine. Funny how it was magically there now. I contacted Otterbox about the incident trying to find away to get my package, and even they where confused as to what was going on. They sent me copies of what I needed to have my package released to me from the USPS center, and now its magically not there again. Imagine that... Luckily Otterbox is replacing the case and paid for new shipping so it won't go through USPS this time.

Last time I checked, theft of mail is a federal crime in the U.S. I really don't understand how these employees still have a job, let alone not having charges brought against them.

AVOID THIS CENTER AT ALL COST!!!

name: fridaythe13thpartx
text:
Called regarding a package of registered mail....left me on hold for over an hour...nobody ever came back on the line to give a status update.
I actually drove down to the post office(still on hold mind you)spoke to someone in person then the manager who at least took down my contact info.
Still no word on where my registered package is or any update on its status for redelivery.Seems to be missing somehow.
I left the post office no more informed than when I arrived.
Was still on hold by the way.
If you have a choice don’t opt for USPS registered mail service for any delivery.

name: Angela Quarles
text: Expected an Amazon delivery at my business, which said it would be delivered by 8PM yesterday. No delivery, no mail. Clicked on track packages and it said business was closed, which means they didn't even try on a Saturday because my business was open from 9 AM to 9 PM

name: aaliyah kyles
text: It’s a shame but always in a our black community where he have so much disgusting staff. Really need to find new employees ASAP

name: SANDRA PRESCOTT
text: My postal carrier from this postal office does not pay attention to names and address on my mail. I receive mail that was supposed to be for my neighbors or business down the street. So, makes you wonder if I am receiving all of MY mail. She needs to take off her earphones and pay attention. If things don't get better I will file a formal complaint.

name: Brian Dunbar
text: The staff isn't very friendly, but it's a Post Office. They mail things. Haven't failed me yet. At the end of the day, they're there to drop your envelope in a bucket, not give you a high five and tell you your hair looks nice. And who knows? Maybe you needed to be knocked down a peg or two today and they did you a favor.

name: 56TheAnimal
text: So unhelpful everytime my mail woman Kennitha comes by she’s screaming and cursing at the top of her lungs into her phone headset and is impossible to reach for help.  Personal calls on the job are bad enough, but the constant cursing and yelling makes dealing with her impossible.

name: Tiffany Mack
text: This is the worst post office ever!!!!! They are so rude!!!! They ALWAYS loose ur packages & when you call to speak to a supervisor, they defend their carrier without getting your version of the facts. Everyone at this location should be fired. And hire ppl who actually do their jobs!!!!

name: Warren Stone
text: Nothing!!!! The mail carriers are slow as hell, in my area. The houses are about 5ft apart and you have to drive to every house. Some are wasting gas and damn lazy. They need to have a physical fitness exam for that job. Our money we'll spent. Hell no!!!

name: Ben Masab
text: Trashy and ghetto. No respect for theirselves or the community. Unproffesional

name: Jaheim Bell
text: Delivered 2/3 of my packages and all we’re supposed to come on the same day and lied and said it was delivered

name: Liz
text: Why does the website say they open at 8:00, but Im here at 8:25 and the doors are locked.. service is okay... sometimes..

name: Rameh Khazen
text: This post office is terrible. Highly likely you will be shot going to it, so don't go at night. Two people have been murdered in the parking lot in the last few years. Also, the postal workers don't care if the mail gets delivered or if you get any help at all. I've had multiple issues with them. I use to ONLY use USPS and now I only use it when I have too. Such a shame when people have no pride in their work.

name: Steven Evans
text: Worst customer service ever. Packages never come on time.

name: Jeremy Kervin
text: No one's in a hurry

name: Paul Stahl
text: This company has the most amazing service and professional assistance of any copy shop I have every worked with.   I needed a rapid turnaround order, bound and hand delivered in downtown with a 45 minute deadline.  This was for a large government bid.  They made my deadline with 15 minutes to spare!  I can't recommend them highly enough!

name: Southern Stream Live
text: Kwik Kopy is definitely Kwik! They provide excellent customer service. We have always been overly satisfied with every order. Southern Stream Live definitely recommends Kwik Kopy for all your printing needs! Thank you guys!

resp.text: Thank you for your recommendation! We are delighted to have such an amazing customer.

name: Destiny Williams
text:
Kwik Kopyshop is an outstanding business! We needed work done with a 2 day turn around time. Mark not only ensured that Kwik Kopy could do it, but he also offered recommendations that would save us money without compromising the quality of our product.

It was great working with Keri as well! She was always kind and calm, communicated effectively, and overall offered quality customer service.

Not to mention, our signs look great!

Thank you, Kwik Kopyshop, for providing such great services!

name: Bryan Carter
text: Excellent service. "Kwik" and quality work. I use them all the time.

name: Ronald White
text: They are convenient, quick, and very polite and professional. if you need something taken care of in downtown Montgomery this is the place to go. I would highly recommend them for all of your needs.

name: Delores Hornsby
text: Quick friendly service very sweet ladies

name: Freeman Presson
text: I had a booklet printed and bound here. The work was perfect, and I got a great price. Service was superbly fast and friendly.

name: Jamie McLynn
text: Always the most helpful staff!! Really appreciate the customer service here.

name: Rebecca Stivender
text: They are the best!!  I walked in frantically trying to get an urgent package to family out of town, and Anna was so kind and helpful.  She truly went above and beyond!

name: Madison K.
text: Went into this location not knowing exactly how I wanted my art to be printed, but Anna took the time to talk it through and gave us multiple options. She definitely went the extra mile, and my print turned out even better than what I imagined! Thank you, Anna!!!!

name: Sam Sharples
text: By far the best shipping location in Birmingham. I gladly drive by multiple other UPS and Fedex locations and suffer parking in Five Points to use this location. They don’t nickel and dime customers, but earn business through respect and friendliness.

name: Aakruti Sharma
text: Awesome store with super-friendly staff!

name: CeeDeeAre 4Real
text: Five Stars - Good experience at this UPS store.  Erika, Bradley and Carlos were of tremendous help!  I will go there now on a regular basis.  Thanks so much.

name: Ritika Ramchandani
text: Went it needing to check on a package That I paid for overnight shipping for 3-5 days ago. They basically told me they couldn’t do anything about and that I was informed when dropped the package off that they wouldn’t be able to do anything. I was not informed of that, yet the *manager* persists that “all his people are well trained so he knows that I was informed.” I LAUGHT at that response. Trust your customer if they told you that no one told them what you’re telling them. Do not insult their integrity by CLAIMING that “all your employees are well trained and would’ve told you.” CLEARLY THEY WERE NOT, TRY AGAIN.

resp.text:
Ritika, we hear you and we understand your frustration. As we have mentioned already, we are a third party vendor of UPS services, not UPS themselves. UPS currently does not guarantee delivery dates for any packages due to Covid19. Additionally, once UPS has picked up your package from our retail location, we no longer have possession of it, and therefore cannot just provide it back to you.

We would love it if you direct your concerns to the UPS customer service department at 1-800-742-5877.

name: c p
text: I will never go here, or any other ups store. You pay $200 for the day they tell you, but your package arrives a week later, and all they say is WELL!!!!. Well...... You don't have to worry about my business or anyone I know using you for any shipping needs.

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had an unfortunate experience at The UPS Store in Southside.  We understand your frustration with the cost of shipping and the delivery delay, but the holidays are a tough time for all carriers, not just UPS.  Guarantee dates are suspended due to volume.  Additionally, we at The UPS Store have no control over the pricing or delivery of packages. We are small business owners - franchisees who do not set pricing or guarantees.

As for being told, "Oh, well..." this is a customer service issue that we will look into.  We appreciate you bringing it to our attention and hope you will give us another opportunity to show you the World Class Customer Service we strive for.

name: Rhiannon Deierhoi Reed
text: Have had great success with this location the past two years making calendars for family. Very courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products. I will continue to use this spot for future printing needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We are always glad to hear that we've done our job right - "courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products" describes our mission perfectly!

name: Tina Cao
text: The BEST ever!!! Staffs are so friendly and professional, and they always give me the best experience. Every time I go there they always manage to get me out of there in less than 5 minutes which is IMPRESSIVE!!!

resp.text:
Tina,

We appreciate your review, and we're so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. Come back and see us soon!

name: S King
text: Best place around! All the employees are so nice and eager to help you. Ask for Jaelynn, he’s the best! Spent almost an hour with me trying to work with an issue I had. So awesome

resp.text:
S King,

We're so glad to hear you had a good experience, and we always appreciate a shout-out for an individual staff member. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jason “Squig” McCrory
text: A very professional and knowledgeable staff. The print shop is amazing. As a photographer I work hard capturing images for my clients and The UPS Store In five points always takes care of my needs, so I can serve my clients faster.

resp.text:
Jason,

We appreciate your continued business, and I look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Barbara Schwartz
text:
Better Than the Rest!
Attentive, knowledgeable, engaging staff. Neat, well equipped store. Free parking in back. Took pack & ship order in on Wednesday two weeks before Christmas. Decided to use UPS ground. Packages were delivered several states away on Friday.

resp.text: Barbara, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience with us and received the services you needed! We appreciate you taking the time to leave a detailed review, and we look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Chandra Brown
text: UPS sucks I had to drive around town to find all of their drop boxes that are in weird buildings and convenience stores, and the drop boxes are so small u really can't put in any normal to medium packages. Which isn't convenient. Why would a packing and shipping company have such small drop boxes to begin with. The package wouldn't fit in the box. The post office drop box is much larger. Wow ..... UPS, thanks for nothing.  And all of your locations close early...the latest is open to 7pm. The Main post office is open later than that and less expensive. Why not have at least one location in the City of Birmingham or surrounding areas that are open at least til midnight. UPS is in my opinion is a very inconvenient place to do business with. Two thumbs down

resp.text:
Chandra,

While we here at The UPS Store Southside understand your complaint, you are unfortunately responding to the wrong company.

The UPS Store Southside is a locally owned and operated franchise of The UPS Store, a chain of combination Print Shop and Pack-and-Ship vendor. We are ten folks from Birmingham who do graphic design and digital and wide-format printing and offer UPS, USPS, and DHL services as a third-party vendor.

Your complaint against the United Parcel Service, Inc is an understandable one, but rating our location 1* won't accomplish any change. We aren't the logistics company based out of Atlanta, and this location isn't owned by them either. Your review is understandably but incorrectly levied at us, and that hurts our business, despite that fact that we don't operate UPS trucks, nor do we maintain UPS drop boxes.

We know the name "The UPS Store" makes us sound like a corporate entity, but we're not, or else we couldn't say that the name "The UPS Store" was a stupid choice for loosely-affiliated franchises.

We would kindly ask that you remove your rating if you are not one of our customers, or that you correct your rating to reflect our service correctly if you have commissioned work from us before. Again, that would really help our locally owned small business thrive. We can also put you in touch with people at UPS who can actually help get your complaint to the right people. Please feel free to come in and see us, or email us at Store4088@TheUPSStore.com. We'd genuinely love to help you voice your complaint, as we frequently do to UPS ourselves.

Again, we appreciate your frustration, and we thank you in advance for correcting the record.

Jeff Flannery, Owner
Myra Fabian, Operations
Nick Salyers, Printing

name: Debbie Lagarde
text: I've visited this store numerous times since moving to town. It's become one of my favorite places to do business. The services I've employed include parcel shipment, printing, and notary. Usually I have questions about the task at hand, and the associates have been friendly, knowledgeable, and fun. They also don't mind giving newcomers to the area a head's up about local businesses. Impressed!

resp.text: Debbie, we're so glad to hear you've had a great experience! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Isaac
text:
Notary service is very unprofessional. Kept telling me to wait “couple of minutes” and ended up wasting  30 minutes of my time. My time is more valuable than the cost of your service.

Replying to the owner's response:
I was not informed that it would be up to half an hour. I was told to wait "Few minutes" and even if English isn't my first language, I understood that few ,even though isn't an exact term, it won't be a 20-30 minutes wait. If I didn't say something, I would've ended up waiting for more than 30 minutes. When I called the store the day before, i was told that Notary services are offered when you walk in.  the UPS store on 20th St North truly provides a walk in notary service.

I paid for the service at the cashier in advance as I wanted to save time and the "offer" you are talking about is how one of your employees brought back the money and receipt and handed it to me and told me to go to another store. So you basically kicked me out. That was also very disrespectful.

I never requested a special treatment because of my station or title. So don't use that. I am only informing people on here that the Notary Service is unprofessional.

resp.text:
Isaac,

As we informed you when you arrived, the only notary in-store when you arrived also serves as our General Manager, our Chief Graphic Designer, and our primary Printer. You were informed that it could be several minutes, up to half an hour, and that there were Notaries Public at other stores, which we offered to direct you to. You declined that offer and left after 20 minutes. We apologize that you are dissatisfied with the timeliness in which you were served, however, your time is not more valuable than that of the customers who arrived and submitted orders before you. We are committed to serving all of our customers equally, regardless of station or title.

name: Angie Boston
text: The young lady at the counter greeted me as soon as I walked through the door.  I was returning DirecTV equipment and was somewhat puzzled by the company's instructions which weren't too thorough.  However, she educated me really well on the  items they didn't want returned to them.  She checked that I had not left batteries.in the remote which I had intended to check before leaving home but forgot to do.  She was very friendly, courteous, and  knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Angie, we appreciate your business and look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Ashley Kuntz
text: This is my favorite UPS store in Birmingham. I’d rather wait and go to this store on my way into work than go to the store down the street from my house. The staff at the Southside location are so incredibly helpful. Even when I don’t have everything perfectly prepared, they quickly take care of the package and get me checked out. I can’t believe I actually care enough about a UPS store to write a review, but this one is worth the time. Thanks, Folks. You rock!

resp.text:
Thanks Ashley! We are so thankful for your review. We hope to see you again soon!
-Management

name: Madeline Smith
text: I was in Birmingham from Boston, visiting a critically ill friend at UAB.  In the middle of that stress, urgent business came up.  Thankfully a nurse said 'go to the UPS Store up the street.'  Within minutes I was in the good hands of Bradley and the UPS team.  Printed out the documents, signed, notarized, faxed and then shipped overnight.  All that is part of their business model - however, it was the caring, the calming, the empathy  for my situation that made this an exceptional five star experience.   Grateful.

resp.text: Madeline, I'm so glad to hear you had an exceptional experience at our store, and we keep you and your friend in our hearts during their recovery. We hope you can come back and see us under better circumstances in the future!

name: Lauren Weekley
text:
Best place to go for any design or print needs, hands down!! Nick can work miracles. If you need something done and they for some reason can't do it in house, he'll help you figure out the best way to get it done. Nick has come in early, stayed late, delivered print to me personally when I couldn't pick it up. The entire staff at this store is amazing and helpful. 10/10, 5 stars, A+

Oh and they pack and ship things too

name: Michael Todd
text: Stopped in to drop off a package, very polite and professional staff, will definitely use them again.

resp.text:
Michael,

We're glad you had a good experience, come back and see us!

name: johnnie shaneyfelt
text: Update your store hours on Google so people don’t drive over in the rain during a pandemic to drop off packages. Says your open until 7 but the door says 6

resp.text:
Johnnie,

We appreciate your feedback and we apologize for the miscommunication. Google, without our knowledge, reverted our online hours listing to the pre-Covid hours, In accordance with Gov Ivey's Safer-at-Home ordinance, we will maintain our current limited hours until further notice. Please know you can always check our website and social media accounts for more current updates.

We have informed our tech team, who is working on a fix for the Google listing. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience, and we look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Mel Christian
text: I have issues with the online ordering system but that is not the fault of the local Birmingham, AL  Southside employees. I live in Tuscaloosa and needed six 11 x 17 signs printed in about a five hour window so I could frame them for a Birmingham theatre company. When I called to see if I could get them earlier than the 6pm quote, the woman helping me (I wish I had asked her name but this was the afternoon of  9/13/19 if that helps) said she would change some things around and get them for me by 3pm. I cannot tell you how much time and anxiety that saved me! Also while I as there I noted the other gentleman working  with her jumped up the minute a customer came in and was very professional and cordial.  In a world where customer service has gone down the toilet that really means something! I've also a few years ago popped by to get a notary signature and this location was completely helpful. Only complaint is the parking but...big city...whatcha gonna do? Again, thank you for helping me! It meant so much!

resp.text:
Mel,

We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, and I'm glad we got you taken care of! We are working to improve the parking, look for some major improvements in that area over the next year or so!

Come back and see us anytime, we'll save you a spot!

name: Jo hiNes
text: My printer wasn't working before I had to hwad to class... I emailed them while I was on the way and had my papwrs printed quickly. I was in and out in 5 minutes. I also bought a sympathy card and mailed off a package. They we're also VERY nice and courteous! Will definitely be back!!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind review! We work really hard at providing world class customer service to everyone no matter how big or small the job is; We look forward to seeing you again.
Thanks
-Management

name: Brandon Moore
text: I visited this store yesterday to drop off a package. I needed the box taped and I also need the label cut and taped to the box. I went in expecting them to sell me a roll of tape and scissors like the post office would make you do. I was surprised when I walked in to a very friendly staff that took my package and said well have this taped and ready to go today. I was out the door in less than 30 seconds! I highly recommend this ups store for all your shipping needs.

name: Reginald Croom
text: I have had the pleasure of working with the UPS Store team for many years. They are very attentive and detail oriented. A little patience is required considering the nature of this business. Great service, Great team!

resp.text: Reggie, we're so glad that you've had a good experience with us, and we're grateful for your continued patronage. We hope to see you soon!

name: Will Webb
text: Great customer service. Thanks especially to Nick for all the help shipping a package with dry ice. This (independently-operated) store really seems to go the extra mile for customers with unusual needs.

name: Gregory Kohlberg
text: Great customer service and I always can count on the deliveries scheduled

resp.text:
Gregory,

We're glad you have great experiences with us, and we're grateful for great customers like you!

name: Heather Dark
text: Unfortunately every time I go in this store (typically Saturday), the same employee is there with a snide remark, inappropriate statement, or just general rudeness that makes this place pretty unplesant for me. But, they’ve never lost a package, and have decent supplies so I’d say that part of the store is great.

resp.text: Heather, we, unfortunately, don't have enough information from what you've given to know what incidents you're referring to. If you would, please email us at store4088@theupsstore.com and answer a few questions for us so we can try to figure out what happened. Thanks.

name: Kristie Rankin
text: This location has always been a positive experience for me. Nick is very professional and almost reads my mind at times it seems.

resp.text: Kristie, we're so glad to hear about your great experience with us! We look forward to serving you again soon!

name: KDE5FAN
text:
Where to begin with this horror show, 1 star is much to high a rating.  The person I was dealing with was so horrible and incompetent that after 5-6 phone calls over 3 days(and zero of 4 emails responded to, emails with all the pertinent information for items to be picked up, packed and shipped) I asked to speak to a manager, well Bradley WAS the manager.  Great.  I asked if he had a supervisor or the owner and he dismissively told me HE was in charge - this is where the attitude ramped up, before it was somewhat subtle.

He would not respond to any email asking for quotes or telling me when they would pick up the items (the pickup service they offer).  It was like he didn't want to have record of the quotes or times in email.  He would respond to direct questions in email with "would you please just call me, how hard is that" - as if my schedule revolved around him.

After 3 weeks of trying to get them to pick up the auction lot, I made arrangements with another UPS store that would pick up the same day.  I called to cancel at the previous store, told Kody (who told Bradley while I was on the phone) and someone else as well and I also emailed the cancellation.  3-4 hours later they used the paperwork from the first email to pick up the items and I was informed by the other UPS store that the items were already picked up (the seller wasn't supposed to release it to them either but that isn't as much their fault)

When they packed up the items they used a huge box, about 3x larger than what was actually necessary basically tripling the cost of everything. It was very expensive now.  I knew this wasn't right so I emailed asking for the weight and dimensions of the box he used, and I got a reply of the dimensions and a "just call us" response.  This was after I had called 4-5 times that day and they were always too busy to talk.  Now he wanted me to call immediately (6 hours after the my first call) and when I didn't he proceeded to call 6 times in 30 minutes while I was  on the other line (call waiting beeping 40-50 times for each call, he just let it ring harassing me - I couldn't end my call it was important and why I called 6 hours prior and used email).

This harassment continued 3 more times with about 2-3 calls each time until their closing time (total of about 13-15 calls, ringing non-stop b/c no voicemail turned on).

My calls the next two days were hung up on, I never knew who answered the phone, but 5 calls were immediately hung up on when they were switched to an employee.

I called the other UPS store I had scheduled and told them what was going on and was going to have them pick up the items to ship.  I was informed of who to ask for at the other store and that they would be helpful.  I called back and got someone I hadn't worked with - Mikee.

This was a delight. From the very beginning the attitude was like night and day.  Bradley has no business working with customers or in customer service.  Mikee was helpful, promptly returning emails with complete answers and readable sentences, complete quotes, etc.  Included in the emails were the photos of how Bradley wrapped the items and it looked like a 4yr old had done it.

There were a couple fragile items, noted 3-4 times in previous emails (maybe Bradley can't read, IDK) that were to be wrapped in bubble wrap b/c they were glass.  These were the only things not in bubble wrap.  The large bulky durable plastic items were layered in bubble wrap and I told him they didn't need ANY.  So, Mikee took everything out of Bradley's packaging and re-packaged the items and did an EXCELLENT job.  I would rate that  part 5 stars,  but after 3+ weeks with Bradley, 1 star is too much.

The final shipping was less than 1/2 what Bradley quoted (and it wasn't $5 vs $10, it was MUCH higher).  The items arrived and everything looks to be in  order.

I just can't understand how this business can make Bradley a manager and deal with customers. I had another problem with  them 1 year ago with bad packaging on a piece of glassware, it looked like a 4yr old wrapped it too.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review. We truly do appreciate your feedback on where we can improve - and clearly, there is much room for improvement with the way we handled your shipment. We apologize that we fell short of the "World Class Customer Service" you were entitled to. We have addressed the situation with the manager and are taking steps to ensure it doesn't happen again. We acknowledge the 1-star rating we received from you and would appreciate the opportunity to prove to you that we are a 5-star store.

name: Oakside8
text: Great service. Friendly employees.

resp.text:
Oakside,

Great review, friendly customer. Come back and see us anytime and let us bump that 'great' up to an 'excellent'!

name: William Somerall
text: Courteous, attentive, and helpful. Highly recommended.

resp.text:
William,

We can't thank you enough for taking the time to leave us a review. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Larabeth Guthrie
text: This location has helped make sure I have professional items at a competitive rate regularly.  They are diligent about making sure everything is correct.

name: Jake Linder
text: Awful customer service. Three employees and not one said hello or I’ll be right with you. When I was finally waited on, the employee left me to help another customer and ignored me. UPS isn’t a charity and should expect professionalism from those they hire to represent them.

resp.text:
Jake,

First I want to thank you personally for taking the time to leave a review. We can't improve if we aren't held accountable, and I truly appreciate you taking the time.

Our SOP includes both an immediate greeting, as well as point-to-point customer assistance. Those procedures clearly were not followed, and for that we apologize. This is out of alignment with how we do business, and we are actively working to rectify those issues.

We know you have a choice in who you spend your money with, and we are working diligently to be better because you, the customer, deserve it. We look forward to doing better for you in the future.

name: Susan Henderson
text:
The UPS Store in Warrington, (Pensacola), Florida is equipped with the most courteous and knowledgeable staff who go above and beyond to help their customers.  It's a wonderful experience and I always get great service, walking out feeling good to have been helped by such nice people.  I have been to other UPS stores and haven't had the same experience.
Tom Kuklish is the owner/manager of this store and he is outstanding, always making sure his customers are taken care of, and if there are any problems, he's ready to solve them promptly and professionally.
S. Henderson

name: Champion Deivanayagam
text: Very professional service and the staff are always willing to help

resp.text: Champion, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our store, and we look forward to working with you again in the future. Come back and see us!

name: S Garg
text: There is one of your employees at 20th Street South Birmingham store who is very rude. I have been to the store multiple times and he always behaves in a very condescending way. He has done it every time I go to the store, even if he is not assisting me. I think he is the store manager, Don't remember his name. He is tall white male, 6Ft something tall. I am writing this message as today he accused me of taking the store pen without checking if the store property was in place or not. I was carrying my own pen and I don't give a damn about a $1 pen but to be called out when it clearly wasn't UPS property without checking was really really rude. Please take necessary action, Thank you

name: Adrian Darren
text:
A few days ago I came in to have some designs and prints made up quickly.  I gave the instructions to the main graphics person and he didn't follow them.  I was upset with the situation and then he had the audacity to argue my instructions with me.  It wasted my time and I couldn't believe that was his idea of customer service.

I will be taking my business to the store in Homewood from now on.

resp.text: Unfortunately, as we expressed to you that day, The person you spoke with first (our night manager) and the person you spoke with second (our Print Manager) are two different people. As you'll recall, our Print Manager attempted to express this to you that day, as he wasn't in the store at that time you claimed to have spoken with him. Additionally, the reason why your instructions weren't followed was because when asked multiple times about your instructions, your answer was "I don't care." In the future, speaking to the correct people and making specific requests will eliminate the guesswork.

name: Lisa Mani
text: Very professional and courteous on the phone and in the store.

Thank You Lisa! We appreciate your kind response and we look forward to doing future business with you.
-Management

name: Dee Winter
text: THE Worst UPS store.   Staff does not return calls and reply to emails.  They make promises that they don't support.

resp.text:
Dee,

Firstly, thank you for taking the time. I know nobody enjoys having a negative experience, regardless of the 'why', but it would help me immensely to know more about your specific instance. If you'd be so kind, please email us directly at store4088@theupsstore.com and let us know more about what happened. We take situations like this very seriously, but we often don't even know something has happened off-book until we see reviews like this.

I'm sorry you had a bad experience, and I'd like to do what I can to fix that for the future, and see if there's anything we can do to rectify your specific issue as well. Again, we sincerely thank you for taking the time to hold us accountable, it's the only way we can improve.

The staff was not helpful.

resp.text: We're sorry about the mix-up. As our employees expressed to you in-store, The UPS Store locations are not owned or operated by the United Parcel Service. As such, we are unable to accept unlabeled​ packages that are intended for UPS pickup, as that is a service which that company offers. We again apologize for any distress this caused you, and we'd be more than happy to help you contact the correct people in regards to your complaint against UPS.

name: Bo Time
text: Not a real UPS store, you cannot use accounts to ship from here. Store is not marked as an affiliate  but is. Staff Is discourteous.

resp.text:
Mr. Time,

This incident seems to arise from a fundamental misunderstanding about how the UPS Corporate umbrella works. Every single The UPS Store location is an individual franchise operating under The UPS Store, Inc. brand, a brand that is a wholly owned subsidiary of the United Parcel Service. We are not 'affiliates,' we are a child company that is both wholly owned and legally distinct from UPS, Inc. As such, we are required to follow UPS corporate policy as well as The UPS Store Corporate policy. This is not unique to ours or any other The UPS Store location.

UPS requires all UPS Customer Centers and The UPS Store locations to maintain their own 'Third Party Account' (also known as a UPS Shipping Account) and does not allow for any entity with a Shipping Account to ship using another entity's account number.

We, as The UPS Store Southside, would love to be able to accept these account numbers for payment, but we are explicitly forbidden from doing so. We do, however, apologize for the inconvenience this caused you. As you'll recall, when you came in on Friday, November 3rd at around 2pm, our associate did attempt to explain this to you. While we understand better than most just how confusing and frustrating some UPS regulations and policies can be, especially from the outside-looking-in, we feel that describing our staff as discourteous is, at the very least, misleading.

We hope this adequately resolves any lingering confusion, and if that's not the case, we invite you to reach out to us for further clarification.

Thanks!
~Management

resp.text:
Hi Daphne, we apologize that your service wasn't 100% satisfactory. If you wouldn't mind emailing the store (Store4088@TheUpsStore.com) with a detailed account of what you experienced, we'll be happy to sort out the issue!

Thank you! -Management

resp.text: We're sorry that you had to wait for our notary, who at the time was battling an illness that required frequent restroom visits. We understand waiting on medical issues can be frustrating, but unfortunately, that was simply the only option available, as the Notary Public position is not available to all staff, and as such, they were the only one on duty that day. However, please note that the Notary Public did, in fact, inform you of the issue when you were seated, and as such you were not left unattended. You were simply served in as timely of a manner as possible, given the circumstances.

text: I'm sitting in my manufactured home and no one knocks or blows, I would have heard it. My insurance man comes about fifteen minutes afterwards and knocks. I heard him!! Why is that? It's because he didn't knock. He left a tag on my screen door. Not on the inside door. The screen door was unlocked because I was expecting this wheel for my Harley Davidson!!! Get out and knock!! I work for the postal system, if you blow and you don't see an animal, you get out and make sure you knock!! He never attempted to deliver, he just put the door tag on the outside of the screen door and left!! That's not good business!! Then he goes back to Mobile!! I never try to give bad reviews because I work for the postal system but DO YOUR JOB!!!!! Especially, if I'm sitting and waiting. Just because you pull up in the yard and no one knows you're out there does NOT constitute you doing your job!! KNOCK AND SOMEONE WILL HEAR YOU!! Thank you!!

text: I use to receive my packages on time. I have been ordering online a bit more since covid, but when I receive the tracking info, it never comes when tracking says. Especially with how much those mail carriers make. My recent package was delivered on October 6th to the New Market USPS and was suppose to be delivered the 8th. Today is the 14th and I have yet to receive this package. My last package they held for 2 weeks because I have dogs (THAT WERE INSIDE) without sending a notice or anything. Ya I’m a little angry about it.. I’ve actually had my carrier tell me they’re all upset because Amazon is shipping packages through them instead of fedex.. still they get paid to do it and I paid for my product that hasn’t been received because of USPS not because of the company ordered through.. text: The USPS has a simple job to COMPLETE the task concerning my mailbox.Deliver the mail and PICK UP the mail. I'm assuming delivery is a given because I guess I typically receive mail but it is beyond me why I can't get my outgoing mail picked up !!  FLAG FLAG FLAG FLAG it just doesn't get any easier than that!! It's random but enough to be a nuisance. When I place a piece of mail in the box and RAISE THE FLAG the least I expect is the mail is picked up.I REALIZE that socially the world and mail itself is leaning toward electronical avenues but "snail mail" keeps people employed and mouths fed so you would think rural route workers could simply do the easy task at hand and be grateful for having a job.Anyway a note to my mail carrier: IF MY FLAG IS UP PLEASE PICK UP MY MAIL !! Please note I gave a 1 star because 0 stars wasn't available.

I've been on the phone for several hours being transferred to different department  only to find out that my claim was incorrectly entered as damaged property when in fact my property were stolen. Kyle
