name: Paul Cenac, MD
text:
As an Over The Road Trucker, like many people who work long days, it is a great thing to be able to have packages (as well as all mail) accepted, signed for, and safely stored for convenient pickup without worrying about Porch Pirates!
It was also great to establish a mailing address before moving to Mobile, and having a stable address until I finally bought my 'Forever/Die In' House!

name: Terri Roberts
text: My son bought a steering wheel cover from Amazon that was too small for his steering wheel.  It had come in a plastic UPS envelope.   When he took it and the return label to this UPS store, the clerk, Melissa, without even checking, told him it would not fit in the plastic envelope that he would have to buy a box.  SHE CHARGED HIM OVER $13.00 for the box to mail the $17.00 steering wheel cover.  He questioned the price but she insisted it was correct.  He later pulled the receipt from his wallet and discovered she charged him for the box and 2 separate packing charges.  He went back a few days later and they refused to refund anything to him.  Melissa purposely upsold him on this box and packing charges.  We will never use this store again.

name: Xena Wild
text: Fast and everyone had masks on and maintained distance.  Courteous and friendly unlike the last visit to this UPS..

name: Amber Carr
text: The two ladies that assisted me were very nice and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you Amber for the review. Please come back and see us anytime and we will be more than happy to assist you! Have a great weekend!

name: R M
text: They always help me out with my Amazon returns and take care of it for me

name: Ultreya Park
text: Website says call to verify notary services. I've called twice and no answer. It rings to a message that says "enter your remote access code." Also, needing to be verified during the time of the pandemic, is how they are handling services for the elderly at-risk population! You can't just be bandying these people about to drop in on places in find out the things you should be able to find out over the phone. I read some reviews on here that said they were thumbs down on customer service but they had improved. If you can't answer your phone, that is not a good sign!

name: Skye Martin
text: The gentleman that helped me today was total awesome.. He helped from  explaining  shipping to random questions.  He carefully packed my framed picture in a custom box and provided better ideas for the box. I would go back to work with him again.  Thanks again for the help..

name: Amber Pond
text: This place was terrible when we went here a year ago. I went in again recently out of desperation. The line was huge but moved quickly, the lady at the counter was friendly and knowledgeable. I'm so glad it's not the two men that were in here before. I'm glad I can use this UPS store now.

name: Michael Shavers
text: I have to commend and applaud the complete turn around I've noticed from this UPS store location. Being under new management, the staff has made my experiences with this store nothing but pleasant. The level of professionalism and knowledge they now posess really make you, the customer, feel as if you are the only customer.  Kudos to the overhaul. I definitely will continue to do all my shipping with them from now on.

name: Judith Rudel
text:
I needed a package sent off from Amazon. But for this particular package they sent me the label to print. I don’t have a printer so I figured I’d pay a couple of cents to pay for the label to print at this UPS. The employee said it would $7.10 to print my label. I said really.. $7 dollars for a price of paper. So I went across the street to Office Depot to print my label it was a whopping .17 cents. Came back to UPS and now he wanted to charge me to tape my box and the label to it. He said I could buy tape from him and do it myself.  And if I would have paid them to print my label he would have done it complimentary.
SAFE to say I will be using I different location. I have never been to UPS that has treated me this poorly. They are always more than happy to spare a few feet of tape to wrap up my packages. Not to mention Amazon packages. That company brings them so much money it’s unreal. Yet they can’t simply tape a box complimentary.

name: Ashley Coleman
text: I was reluctant to go to this store at first because of all the bad reviews but when I got there, I was very happy with my decision. Every staff member that was there was very pleasant and professional. They all were very knowledgeable and friendly. I asked about the bad reviews and they told me that they are now under new management. I would definitely recommend this store and I will being doing business with them again.

name: Brandie Mclean
text: I’m eight months pregnant I’ve been to this location three times to return the same Amazon package and three times they’ve given me a different reason why they can’t return it. First it was the label even though I have had no problem in the past year and a half of returning Amazon packages. Then it was the tape. They tape the box for the guy behind me but won’t tape the box for me. None of the guys in this Officer friendly every time I get one of them they are rude and condescending. Every time I get one of the females they’re super nice and friendly.

name: james griffin
text: All of the associates at this location has helped me so much with all of my personal and business shipping needs that I don't deal with any other UPS location. The only exception to this rule I have to due to my location at the time I need something shipped or need shipping supplies for a later shipment date..  This is also the only location that is close to my home and business.

resp.text: Thank You James! Please come back and see us anytime. We are here for all your business needs! Have a great weekend!

name: Veronica Kott
text: First: The delivery driver threw my package on to the porch. Second: He left as fast as he could for what reason I couldn't say but not professional at all. Third: He didn't look or care where he delivered it to. It was thrown at a neighbors home. In fact, this is the second time this has been done. I have to say is thank goodness for nice neighbors and UPS should rethink their hiring policies.

name: Nancy Phelps
text: My second time at this store, staff very friendly. Also found out they are under new management. Definitely recommend this store.

name: Joel Lee
text: Walked in to get 2 pages printed, which I do from time to time at different locations. They told me it would cost $7.00 to do this. I said no thanks. Across street at Office Depot it was .34. Why does this location charge so much compared to their other locations?

name: Robyn Brackin
text: The details should actually say “closes at 5:50” instead of 6:00.  We went to this location at 10 till 6 with our items and the door was locked.  When the gentleman came to the door he informed us he had already “shut down his computer and to come back tomorrow at 7:30am”.   I told him I was leaving for Atlanta earlier than that and had googled what time this store closed before making the trip here today.   Didn’t matter.    Computer was closed.  I informed him of the time but like I said - it didn’t matter.    Will not use this location again.

name: Angela Serigny
text: The first experience I had at this UPS store was good however everything since the initial visit has been a long process with the main UPS Company denying my partial refund claim. I received a call today and they told me that I was going to receive a partial refund directly from the manager of this store because of what happened and that he only wanted to keep his customers happy. Now that's how you do good business, a special thanks to him.

name: Mark Scheffler
text: I needed some documents printed so I could sign and fax back to Texas. Both employees stepped up to assist me with the printing and faxing and I was in and out in 20 minutes. I’ll use this location, again!!

name: Cody H
text:
I used to use this store anytime I could due to its location and the capacities it presents itself to have, however, my last few visits will most likely be the last time I go.
Reasons being:
* Prices have gone up drastically compared to other shipping options around town.
* Service on Saturdays is very slow due to only having a single employee working.
*Computer systems seem to be running on a well-outdated Windows7 format and printing equipment was probably invented by Gutenberg.

The employees seem nice and are trying to hold things together, but they have seemed to be constantly overwhelmed during each of my last three visits. Word of advice to management/ owners: "Take care of your employees, and they'll be happy to take care of your customers." I would really love to see this store make a turnaround, but it's not something I'll be holding my breath for anytime in the near future.

name: Andrew Algaze
text:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS STORE!!!! THESE PEOPLE ARE SCAM ARTISTS.

I ship from UPS weekly and their associate Tina tried to charge me $65.00 for shipping that routinely costs me $20-$30. She was polite and friendly to me at first but then became rude and obstinate when I asked her why it was costing me so much to ship this package and lied to me when I challenged her on it. The only reason we settled on the $39.00 total is because I had to catch a flight from the airport. UPS stores are franchise owned and because the franchise itself is a scam many owners must turn to this tactic I get that they have to make money but it's no stretch to say that charging $10 for an 85¢ box is criminal. I'd love to think that the owner of this store would want to do something about this but he'll probably just give her a gold star on the wall.

name: Brandon Badon
text:
Attempted to drop off a package 10 minutes until 6pm (the closing time) the door was locked and the cage around the counter closed, I look at the time and at the closing time on the window and sure enough they had closed early. I looked through the window and the woman behind the counter shakes her head no. I show her that all labels are prepared and all she needed to do was scan the label and take the box, shakes her head no. I plead with the woman in gesture ,but still her and the 2 other employees staring at me from behind the counter were unwavering in there decision to leave me locked out in the cold rain. So here I am typing this in my car. 0 out of 5
12/13/19

name: John Roberson
text: Make the extra drive to the Old Shell location. They will go out of their way to assist you.

name: shelly fortner
text: Horrible customer service. Rude and lazy employees. Id advise folks to use a different location. These people are awful.

name: xtianne18
text:
My package, which contained essential medications, arrived a week late despite paying over $200 for the UPS Express Service (2-day shipment). I have requested for a refund on the service itself, and 1 of the staff promised that a check with the appropriate refund should arrive in our mail. Sad to say, it's been over 2 months and we have never received a check from the party. I've asked my sister to follow up on my behalf (since I am living in Canada) and she went there almost every other week. I've been calling as well, but nobody answers the phone.

I am just disappointed.

name: T-N-TByTracia !!
text:
Very rude and unprofessional staff.
I do not recommend this location

name: Ryan Goggans
text:
Just went in to ship an item. The "lady" working, when confronted with something she was unfamiliar with, was extremely rude, condescending, and confrontational. I was humiliated in front of other customers because this woman didn't know her job and was unwilling to look into the issue further - shipping via Mercari.
She used phrases such as "uh, not happening"; the "owner only has a few franchises so you need to go to a corporate location"; after scanning the code from Mercari giving her instructions "I've never seen this before. Not happening. Don't know what to tell you. You need to go somewhere else."

DISGUSTING display of "customer service". I seriously felt almost scolded by bringing something to her that she didn't know how to do. This happened at roughly 12:15 on Saturday, April 13th, 2019. Hopefully the owner will see this and take action against this employee. She seems to think that by knowing the owner she's exempt from basic human kindness, never mind customer service. I should NEVER leave a business that I'm willing to give money to feeling the way I did today.
I HAVE had great experiences at this location, however. It all depends on the employee. And quite obviously, today's employee needs to be away from people. I understand everyone has bad days, but her behavior is still inexcusable. She was relentless in shutting me down and getting me out of the store because she got flustered about not knowing what to do.

name: Ecko Udezeh
text: i had my friend ship my package to me from Alabama to an APO address for armed forces Europe, first they overcharged her according to USPS it was 114 but UPS charged me 230. Second, they didn't fill out the paperwork correctly so now we don't even know where the package is. UPS says USPS picked it up but the tracking says they have yet to pick it up. USPS says they have not gotten the package, so basically my 150 gift is lost for my daughter for Christmas and i'm out 230 dollars for shipping. I would never use them to ship and I will not give up on getting my refund and my product replaced. Corporate has been called and trust and believed I will keep going up the chain until its fixed

name: Frankie Price
text: Had a drop--off. Was greeted when I entered and treated very well. The manager noticed a lady had a FedEx shipping label, he politely made her aware of it, keeping her from waiting in line. Plus provided directions to their location.

name: Raechel Rodriguez
text:
I went to this UPS location to mail a package to Germany,  the lady in there wasn't very helpful she almost didn't make me pay it was a good thing I asked for a tracking number and then she realized that I never paid for the package, she acted like she was on drugs..
fast forward $230.00 and 7 days later the package is considered lost, according to UPS it was picked up, according to USPS it was not, so when I called to speak to the manager that helped me, they told me she had gotten fired, ( in a matter of 7 days) the " Brandy" woman had NO idea how to help me, put me on hold 5 times for over 10 minutes each time, swore on the phone, and was ill mannered. then finally after getting through to "Randy" he assured me the package was not in there. except before they were so busy they couldn't look. then magically, they looked and didn't find it, so basically now i'm out 230$ my friends kids not getting her Christmas present, shes out $150 on the gift, and there is a lost hoover board some where floating around in thin air..

I would suggest  if your shipping anything that is expensive or want it delivered on time, not to go here. they are unprofessional, rude, and unorganized.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: The service is great however the shipping prices  are high. USPS is alot cheaper.

name: Jennifer Loden
text: Didn't  have my stuff ready after dropping it 5 hours earlier, then the machine broke and it wasn't complete. Now I have to go to FedEx anyway. Wasted trip all around. Did get 30% off my order given back but sometimes that doesn't always make things right. People usually take stuff there that is important and it would be great if it were treated that way.

name: ashley hoven
text: I think that it is great that this location opens at 7:30am

name: thesalesteamllc
text: Terrible people.  They quoted myvhusband 45.00 then  charged my husband for the highest amount possible to ship a package that usually takes 1 to 2 days anyway.  (92.00) When i went to pick package up and ship it alternatively 15 minutes later... the manager said it was already gone and they couldnt give me my package back and the driver wouldnt bring it back.  They deserve a ZERO rating for being crooks and poor customer service.

name: It's Us!
text: Called and verified that they have a notary at this location. Drove 45 miles, met with a person whom needed to sign an adoption consent for a child we are adopting.  Was told by the young girl working that the "notary was busy loading a truck, but would be available tomorrow".  When asked if the notary could spare 3 minutes, was told no.   So much for The UPS Store being there when really needed.

name: Carley Pekelder
text: Will never go back. Wasted $40 on 2nd day delivery for perishable goods when they put SIGNATURE REQUIRED on the package and they didn't at least let me know so I could notify the recipient. Cookies ruined, father's day ruined, $40 gone. And this is the second time this has happened!

name: Heidi B
text: Friendly and helpful staff!

name: IVIr Demon
text: Dropped off a package an was told I couldn't get a receipt

name: Clifford Robinson
text:
Seven dollars to print a label
I got charge $14 for a service

name: Sonya Roman
text: Great service very pleasant people.

name: Martha Dees
text: Great people ready to help in any capacity!!!

name: Gina Dickens
text: Very rude people!

name: Ricky Truong
text: These guys just lock the door in front of my face 2 mins before closing time.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Truong: First, We appreciate your time, feedback, concerns as well as your business. Our policy is to be Open from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Fridays and Saturdays 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Our Computers shut down promptly at 6:30 during the week. The issue you have raised is being reviewed via our In-house 24 Hr Video Camera System plus through our Electronic Door Locking Timing System which also tracks our closure times. We will address our closures times again with all Staff to ensure we abide by our posted closing times. We apologize for any inconvenience(s) you have encountered and look forward to seeing you in the future. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Lynn Wickman
text: Never answer their phone. Shipping prices are insanely high.

name: Bill Campbell
text: NO NOTARY AS ADVERTISED. They don’t send to be good. Not so much under new management. did I mention NO NOTARY?

name: tony vanzant
text: always very helpful,

name: Kenny Hunter
text: Very rude when asking a question

resp.text: Dear Mr. Hunter: First we apologize that you feel that you and your question was not properly addressed or answered in a positive response or manner. In this fast-paced environment where customers rush in and want to conduct their business and be on their way as soon as practical, it may seem that less time is spent on a particular issue. Regardless though please know that your needs are very important to us. Now there have been times where a Customer may come in and unintentionally speak out and over other customers while Staff members are already working directly with the customer in front of them so then a speedy response by the Staff to a question may seem short, but our goal is always to provide the information that you may need. To provide a Positive Customer Service Experience is why we train and what we always strive to provide. Again, we appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again. I will also be glad to personally discuss this further with you at any time. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Evelyn Ellzey
text: Excellent service!!

name: Roberta Goins
text: I had some packages there to pickup the lady in there was sweet and got my packages for me. I am thankful I have some place close toy home that can keep packages and hold them till I go pick them up that way no one can steal them off of my porch if I am gone. Thank you UPS Store

name: Gameu911 Gameutoo
text: Very helpful employees here.  My hat goes off to the customer service provided here on a daily basis.  Highly recommended doing business and transactions at this particular facility.  Keep up the good work and thank you all for your continued service.

name: Karen Hilgartner
text: Hardworking, efficient, and friendly people work here.

name: Lori Weist (Lori D)
text: Great experience! Nice people work here. Always smiling. DON'T GO TO LAGOON PARK! This one is way better

name: Angeles Owens
text: Location is clean, well lighted. Service was quick and prompt ..  👌

name: LFU TMANE
text: RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL my girlfriend had a several packaged delivered to our address before and no problem but now this carrier claims that we provided the wrong address so our item was sent back . When she asked why did our other packaged make it but this one since they were on the same order but in different boxes the employee was rude and careless she got our info and nothing had been resolved since . We order things and expect them to be on time for a number of treasons and for this to happen with no explanation just shows they do this often .

name: Sonya Humphrey
text: Extremely rude employee and supervisor at 1:45 today.... terrible attitude and couldn’t answer questions.... extremely unhelpful, I’ll continue to go here since it’s close to my house, but the female supervisor and the particular lady today I will remember. I mean she was a perfect example of ignorance, I had to explain what a witness signature was.... I can’t believe there are federal employees this stupid and rude...

name: Joan Williams
text: This is the best one around here.

name: T Spencer
text: USPS as a whole is garbage but this location takes the cake. They are dishonest and willing to lie to upsell products and services. I went there on 12/22 to mail my earnest money for a house I was buying. I specifically asked the cashier if it could be guaranteed to be delivered by 12/25. Instead of her informing me that it could not and just advising me to get the regular mail delivery (as all packages would be delivered at the same time) she instead sold me expensive express 1 day delivery for 12/24 that was not guaranteed and even attempted to get me to pay an additional $10-$12 for guaranteed delivery on 12/23 while KNOWING THE ENTIRE TIME THAT IT WAS NOT POSSIBLE. After my earnest money did not arrive, I attempted to get a refund of the full price or at least the price difference in the two services and was told they would not give me anything for my troubles even though it was all caused by their dishonest employee. I hope that USPS as a whole gets shut down because its truly trash. A bunch of over paid people being lazy, dishonest and unwilling to truly help anyone outside of themselves. I suggest always using Fedex instead because its not worth the trouble you are sure to encounter dealing with USPS.

name: katie Howard
text: Friendly courteous knowledgeable professional service oriented

name: Dorothy Bibbs
text: Service is good and clerks are friendly and helpful.

name: Marcus Blakemore
text: Great location .

name: Lyn Adams
text: Good service, quick and easy.

name: Michael Givens
text: I think this is the best place

name: Amy Fig
text: Can you say "rude"?

name: Theodore Moon
text: Wow

name: AuthenTech - Ben Schmanke
text: Customer service is usually nice and kind. The major downfall though, there always seems to be a line, usually a LONG line and they only have one employee at the front, although there are two registers. So I guess the obvious should be stated, if you need any desk service, be prepared to wait in line for a solid minimum 10-15 minutes, though possibly much longer as well. 🤦‍♂️ Sorts feels like the DMV each time I visit, a warm tingling feeling.

name: koko koko
text: For some reason, i do not receive any my mail delivery or pick up my packages by post office on Saturday. Is delivery driver just decide to take sometime day off on Saturday?

name: Teena
text: Sherrie is the best! I know most post offices get a bad rep, but this one has always been my favorite. The employees are helpful, patient, and knowledgeable. Sherrie always helps me find the cheapest way to mail in my returns or my international packages. I'm sad that I'm moving out of this area and losing this gem.

name: Kendrick Richey
text: I love the service and always fast and easy to get in and out. My post office of choice in this area

name: TL Mitch
text: The staff is incredible at this location!  I've never experienced better customer service!  Extremely fast moving and informative of any questions or concerns. I just wish they opened on Saturdays to accommodate the public as some of the other sites provide.

name: philip coffman
text: Packages constantly stolen by bham driver. But i got him this time. 2 packages were sent  to 2 different towns . In bham they got scanned and weight is showing the same. However , they both arrived empty. Its over 10.000 worth of brand clothing... the only place both packages crossed the path was on the truck from bham to hsv

name: Deb in Alabama
text:
CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EXCELLENT HERE!  This place is small with only 2 people working.  However, they are EXTREMELY helpful, friendly & don't make you feel "rushed".  I had a variety of things to send, both locally, in the US & internationally (Germany).

In particular, Ms. Laurie was very-very helpful & patient with me, which I can't express enough how grateful I am.  I also wanted some cute stamps & she showed me SEVERAL before I finally settled on the Scooby Doo ones (FUN)!

Long story short ...I like this location  because it's convenient.  I walked in expecting a long line, due to Christmas & was surprised that I was the only customer there (not for long though)!

Also, Ms. Sherrie was very helpful & answered a few questions I had about the shipping boxes.

SO BIG-BIG KUDOS TO MS. LAURIE & MS. SHERRIE ...they both greatly deserve it!

Have a blessed New Year!

name: William Andrews
text: Fast service, acceptable customer service.  Wide variety of packing material for sale if you need something quick.  Only complaint was the music coming from a personal radio was a little too loud.  Also, they definitely need to resurface/pave the parking lot.

name: A C
text: Lady was nice to me when I told her I was shipping live bugs.

name: Eric&Theresa Albert
text: They are always helpful & pleasant.  The only USPS location I will use!

name: Eric Ibarra
text: This is a small post office, but it's usually not as crowded and a bit faster than the post office on Hughes Rd.

name: Lee Griggs
text: Anthony has always been extremely helpful and I greatly appreciate the outstanding service! Thanks!

name: Andrew Ohlinger
text: Lynn Price was super helpful getting all our packages out! 👍

name: Jennifer Knox
text: Best post office on the planet! David Knox you rock!!!

name: Jimmy Earskine
text: Great customer service

name: Krystin Gentry
text: It was hard to find this place even with Google Maps because it didn't show that it was located in the Ace Hardware building. I did not see any UPS signs on the doors but was helped when I asked someone from weathers furniture. I wish Google Maps would just say that it's located inside the building.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Ronnie Dalton
text: I approached the counter and the clerk was orienting an employee. I stood there several minutes before she offered to take my package which was heavy. The directions of where the drop off are a little vague

resp.text: This is not the ideal experience we would like you to have at this location. Your feedback will help us improve your future experience. If you need further assistance from UPS, please contact us with your information via a Private Message or Direct Message on one of our social channels: Facebook @UPS or Twitter @UPSHelp.

name: James Richardson
text: Horrible! Every time I'm supposed to get a package they supposedly have the wrong apartment number. I don't live in an apartment. Fedex never has a problem finding my house and they come from Madison AL. (not local) I've never experienced such repeated incompetence before.  I have a sign on my mailbox post, that's a foot tall with reflective numbers on it.

resp.text: We apologize your experience at this location did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve your future experience. If you need further assistance from UPS, please contact us with your information via a Private Message or Direct Message on one of our social channels: Facebook @UPS or Twitter @UPSHelp.

name: Deborah Cain
text: Main office wasn't open at scheduled time. A lady suggested that I go around the building and a driver took my package.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: She Mac
text: If you review they reply (automatically I'm certain) yet website to print label from home & customer service phone numbers will leave you on hold for 20 minutes...  Guess I'll go to USPS Saturday Morning UGH!

resp.text: We apologize your experience at this location did not meet your expectations.  Your feedback will help us improve your future experience.  If you need further assistance from UPS, please contact us with your information via a Private Message or Direct Message on one of our social channels: Facebook @UPS or Twitter @UPSHelp.

name: mitchell clifton
text: Great customer service

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Rhonda Motes
text: One driver is able to find our house on Monday but another driver can't find our house on Tuesday. It hasn't moved! What is up with so many people relying on GPS? It doesn't give you proper directions to our house.

name: B.D. Jahnke
text: Clean, and service is great

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Callie Perry
text: Very nice workers

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: witts end
text: I would give 0 stars if I could. They dropped a package off at the wrong address and had someone sign for it. Now they have no idea where the package was dropped off. GPS takes you straight to my house. I live on a main thoroughfare as well. Michelle Taylor

name: Brooke McIntire
text: I have had packages delivered to the wrong address and disappear into thin air so many times in the Shoals when UPS is the courier. This last issue takes the cake though. On Thursday night, my insulin pump stopped working. I called the manufacturer and they immediately overnighted a replacement using UPS. First the said package was supposedly left off the plane in Louisville, KY. This added a full day to the delivery. Then, the next day, it arrived in Muscle Shoals and was put on the vehicle and marked “out for delivery” at 7:04am. At a few minutes past 7pm, the status changed back to “In Transit”. I called customer service and even after escalating was told no one would answer them at the Muscle Shoals distribution center and the LIFE OR DEATH package that was supposed to be here Friday now won’t be here before Monday. Hopefully they won’t be delivering the device that keeps me alive to my grieving family on Monday.

name: Gennabellz YT
text: Cant seem to function on an elementary level.. Door Dash drivers can find my house more efficiently. I have waited 3 days for them to make a simple delivery.. absolutely pathetic

name: Jeremiah E
text: Friendly staff, very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Kathy Smith
text: I had ordered something and forgot to change my address since I moved. I called and talked to two different people, they were extremely helpful and called me back to let me know that they got the address changed and my package would be out for delivery today.

name: Toby Hazel
text: Due to a package not being able to be delivered because the address was incorrect we received a post card(with the incorrect address) saying to pick it up at the UPS place in Muscle Shoals. Signs on the door tell you to go to the west side of the building. No signs telling you where that is but I did find a female employee who was very helpful in tracking my package down.

name: Kisha Ponce
text: Left my toddlers Christmas present somewhere else, noticed my tracking information said delivered at door and guess what it wasn't delivered at door it was no where to be found. Get better drivers who actually deliver the items to the correct person, not ones who just leave items at the wrong places.

name: Shanna Stowe
text: This is more the fault of the 1-800 customer service department. I did not ask for my package to be held at the distribution center. But because I called for some reason the lady decided to have it held there. Good going UPS, now they WON’T deliver to my house. I have to drive from the next county over to get my package! I am so mad at UPS after sitting here waiting for my package!

name: Wayne Thompson
text: Courteous and quick

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Hunter Haney
text: Placed my shipment to be held at distribution so I could pick up because I have a very late route. They put my items on the truck anyways. I then tried to set up a meeting with the driver. Driver doesn't answer the phone call.

name: Daniel West
text: 100 % Great work. Did everything I asked. I am more than pleased. Great company. Amazing work guys

name: Kelly Edmond
text: Ups needs to get there drivers together and make sure they hiring the right people for the job cause I am now missing two packages that is my kids Xmas and they can't even tell me who the driver so I will be paying them a visit in the morning cause I need my packages since the driver couldn't make sure that it was at the right house if they stop just pull up everywhere and stop packages at house without knocking on the door first

name: James Richardson
text: So far to date this group has screwed up three of the four orders I've made. Once a two day delivery took nearly two weeks, one package was loaded on the truck for delivery and then taken back to facility for some unknown reason and most recently, tracking indicated my package had arrived and was delivered but there was no package delivered. I can't wait to hear what ridiculous excuse they have for this one. I'll be turning this in to the BBB when I get it sorted out.

name: Jordan Smith
text: Literally the worst shipping company ever. If you want you package on time do not use them they always deliver late. I even payed for next day shipping and it took a week. This is not a one time occurs lance it's constant. I wish I could give negative stars. I hope their corporate offices will see this post,so hopefully something can be done about it.

name: Matt Davidson (Matt20)
text: The worst UPS place I have been to. Negative stars.

name: Hunter Williams
text: They can't seem to deliver a package to my house, I've had to go pick up everything I have shipped thru ups...worst shipping ever

name: Vanessa Smith
text: Love it

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Shai G
text: They hardly ever open on time. The sign states 3:30 but it is more like 3:45 or 4:00.

text: Always delivered on date expected!

text: On time

name: Leroy wright
text: There great

name: James Butler

name: Tarrah Vigue
text: He stopped taking prepaid packages suddenly(why???) And wasn’t very friendly either.

text: nice store .

text:
This post office is very spacious
It is always clean.  Employees are ok.  I hate going in there.

name: Amanda Craft
text: I love coming to this post office for all my mailing needs.

name: Heather Butler
text: This place is cool but far

name: Morgan Elizabeth Dalton
text: Although I got my letter mailed to my pen pal. The lady at the counter was the most rude lady. She is very rude. A cowboy tried to mail a package and she said she couldn't label it with all the tape on it. And when he tried to get the tape off she told him to move some where else then I come back later. She was rude to every person with NO MANNERS. If this is how we treat each other then we need to just to get the fruit of the spirit and put a smile on our face and start being kind.

name: Kurt Byrd
text: Very rude did not try  to explian problem just seem like I was bothering her

name: Justin Duke
text: I know it was almost 430 and I was cutting it super close but they were locked up at 428. I really needed my sons medicine and they obviously were ready to go. I'm trying to pick this up because it was supposedly attempted to be delivered several times but no one ever came to my door.

name: Dorrell Perry
text: I understand the number goes not to office. But hours are posted.. service here is friendly, helpful. Never been long lines....so I am satisfied

name: Ryan Stonecipher
text: Delivery is terrible. The people show total disregard for the stuff they’re delivering. They should probably consider firing everyone and starting over.

name: Amy Murray
text:
I hate that I am required to even leave one star, because this location deserves no star. I cringe every time I receive a notification showing that a package is being delivered by USPS, because I know there will be an issue.
More often than not, I will receive a notification saying that a package has been delivered and left in the mailbox. Normally it is a box that would not have fit in the mailbox anyway. We always file a tracking complaint and will receive an email from this post office (George Todd Dr) saying that they will look into it and never hear another word. The package almost always mysteriously shows up the next day. We have stopped ordering supplements or vitamins through the mail, because every single order is marked delivered and then arrives a day or two later in an open box.
This is very concerning. Nothing is ever done. I have even complained to Amazon about this. Other carriers do not seem to have the same issue, UPS and FEDex deliver on time and in the rare case that there is an issue, they are honest and report a delay. This particular post office just lies.

name: Roderick Hall
text: Every experience I've had at this post office has been horrible. I honestly cringe every time I order a package and it says it'll be delivered by USPS,  because it's likely that I won't receive my package. The customer service is awful, the employees are very rude and don't care about giving customers the right amount of care that should be afforded to them. I understand things may be more stressful because of the pandemic but the service here is absolutely not acceptable. There needs to be a significant change to management.

name: Twyla Knight
text: Every time I go to this post office there is a long line and one worker. They need some additional workers given that they are located in a business area and covers a very broad area. Whoever is running this facility is not doing a very good job. Not everyone is management material.

name: Aggie Mae
text: Had a package marked as delivered on tracking (was late) but it was never received. This was the first incident I've ever had with USPS but with the COVID situation, things are getting messed up, and if they lose your package or deliver it to another address (who knows what happened), they will not rectify the problem but will only say they are sorry. Disappointed that I didn't get my package and they will only process claims if a package meets certain criteria. If not as in my case, you are so out of luck when they are the ones that dropped the ball.

name: Sonia R
text: Have not received 2 packages both of which had my medication in. I’ve opened cases but nobody there cares and they never answer the phone... ever. I’ve called hundreds of times. So I guess I’m just out of my money and my much needed prescriptions. Pretty typical of everything in Montgomery

name: Bethany Howard
text: The customer service rather it is face to face or over the phone is horrible. My packages are never delivered on time, ever and the post office will not leave a not whatsoever, and always hold my packages! The phone wait times are 45 to 60 minutes just to speak to a representative. Who ever is the manger of this postal office is doing a horrible job, just being completely honest here.

name: Grace Lim
text: THE WORST post office. Incompetent and unorganized. They're in a SEVERE need of a management change as soon as possible.

name: Morgan Taylor
text: I’ve ordered multiple items on amazon prime the last few weeks, and every single time they have been delivered by USPS, they have never arrived on time. They even mark my packages as having been delivered, and even SPECIFICALLY left in my mailbox. But no package will be in it. I ordered some items that I needed for my week long vacation, and I used amazon prime (with two day shipping), and I ordered my items a full week before my vacation. Not only did they not arrive on time, they were marked as “delivered” and left in my mailbox, but nothing was in there. I tried calling the number from the website the next day, and the number isn’t even in service. So I drove to the post office and they couldn’t find my package. So they lost it, but according to my amazon app, the mail carrier left it in my mailbox. I have NEVER had so many issues with any other service. I cringe when I see that my packages are going to be delivered by USPS because I know if they aren’t lost, they’ll be delivered late.

name: Josue Sanchez
text: They are making apartments residents pick up all packages at the post office.

name: Alma Bowen
text: Mail is not received daily as shown in the USPS.com.  Often, mail shown is NOT received nor sent back to the sender!  Where did it go?  Must be delivered in a hole or thrown in the garbage!!  Also, mail is not delivered in a timely manner.  I am currently writing a letter to the Post Master!  Hope it helps because verbal communication doesn't seem to work!

name: LM
text: Why aren't you working? Why is it not working properly?? Work correctly and be kind to your customers. Don't show laziness at work!

name: Mary L
text: If I could give them a negative star I would. At this post office they always put attempted deliver when they didn’t actually attempt anything and I’ve been dealing with a lost package issue since April of 2020 and still haven’t received a resolution. Every time I go there they say that they’ll call me and I never receive anything. I’ve opened a case to have my funds refunded and still nothing. The worst post office ever!!!

name: Mary Plemons
text: Postman is not able to get his key to fit or open our mailboxes at our apartment complex, so we havent gotten mail for several days! I am expecting my new checkbooks, bills to pay and important mail! Guess I will have to drive to the facility and see if I can pick it up?! Why does it take so long for him to get a new key? Someone said he had to write up a "report"!!??

name: Daniel Drew
text: A garbage location! Workers there act low class and rude, highly recommend doing business with FedEx and UPS instead of this place, and if you absolutely have to Go to another location!

name: Priya Dionne
text: If i could give this establishment negative stars I would. I had a package that was suppose to be delivered on May 9th. On May 13th I went to see about my package. The lady that was at the counter decided not to look for my package because there was "too much to look through." I heard plenty of people in the back that could have looked through the pile of packages. But she instead didn't want to do any work. I was told to leave my name and number to be notified of when they found my package. The next day my package was sent and returned because she didn't notify the next person coming in of the situation about my package. I wasn't told anything about it. I found out when I returned on the 19th I was given the entire run around and still haven't received my package. I am totally disappointed in the services that I received by this post office.

name: Garrett Weathers
text: I'd give zero stars because this place has lost my packages like 5 times. It has now been 2 weeks with nothing but a single update that they are investigating it no updates no anything. It is literally the worst post office I have ever used.. ever. Is it possible to get a different post office to deliver my mail? They won't even answer the phone.

name: Jon Seal
text:
I am attempted to receive a package.  This is generally something I expect to be able to do from the post office.
I found a reDelivery slip in my mailbox for a package requiring a signature that has a date & time stamp indicating that no one was available for signature, at a time when I was home, in my living room, 12 feet from the front door and working door bell.  I am confident that no actual attempt was made.
The hours on their reDelivery slip are incorrect and obviously have been for some time, as the correct hours are painted on their door.  I found that out when I attempted to pick it up myself.  Sure, I could have double checked online.  But, why would I question a document from the Post Office.  I guess my expectations were too high.
Two days into this process and the tracking number and QR code have still not been loaded into the USPS system so that I can even attempt to schedule a redelivery or pickup.
I don't need smiling customer service or nice ambiance.  I do need the post office to be able to deliver a package or let me go get it from them without this kind of ridiculousness.

name: Kimyarda Jones
text: I constantly receive re delivery slips when I work from home and am always available.   Multiple times I have watched the postal driver drive past after a re delivery confirmation was given with a request to beep the horn with my front door open and I was still not notified of my delivery ever.  This post office is a disappointment on many levels.

name: Carol Roberts
text: This is the Post Office for our neighborhood and we are blessed to have two wonderful mail carriers. They always make sure I get my packages and go above and beyond to help. The Post Office itself has a Saturday morning pick up for missed packages that I appreciate. The people there have always been helpful for me.

name: James Mcbride
text:
On 8/29/20
I received a package from the usps but wasn't home so i knew it was on the way so i sent my neighbor to check my box because they left one on top of my box before but heading down the road and this is how she found my package with people taking people items

name: Lori Weist (Lori D)
text: There needs to be a zero star option. Never a good experience. Negative attitudes. Today their system is down so I have to go to another post office. Also lines are always long. My least favorite place on the planet.

name: Megan Taylor
text: Lost a package for 3 weeks. I kept getting notifications that it was ready for pickup but everytime (3 in total) I went to the location to pick it up they said they couldn't find it and their system showed "in transit" but they couldn't tell me to where. Then randomly I get a delivery slip telling me I OWE $10 in postage.

name: Lakisha Harris
text: Mail is delivered to late

name: LeCretia Snow Middleton
text: The phone is always off of the hook. I placed a case and no one will do anything about a package that I still have no details about the location. I made a special trip to the location, left a message for the person in charge and still have not gotten a return message. This is absolutely ridiculous. I am so disgusted with the entire process.

name: Latrice Bradley
text: I was told on Friday that a package would be re-delivered when I called and gave them the missing suite number for my shipping address.  I called again today since I still had not received it and was told that it had been returned to sender the day before.  Both ladies I spoke to were nice and courteous.  But it would have been really great to get my package delivered as I was told I would.

name: Brandon Davis
text: Unhelpful and lost my package which is putting me out $700!

name: Katphishe #9749
text:
Expected Delivery Date: Nov. 14
Arrived at Post Office on Nov. 14 at 7:11 AM

Now, not only is it 12 hours later, but my package still reads a Nov. 14 expected delivery date.

This problem seems to stretch pretty much all across USPS. AAtleast shipping was free, albeit thanks to the website I ordered from, not USPS.

EDIT: Went from two to one stars as my package now has no expected delivery date, in contrast to yesterday. I plan to pick up the package from the post office myself.

name: Karen Taylor
text: Completely rude customer service. Cut me off and acted like i was a bother

name: Ryan Mac55
text: Never deliver before 5. Then have an attitude. Have had to stay at work until 8 more times than I can count to make sure I got a customers part. Can’t keep up with how much outgoing mail has been lost too. Look at the reviews it will tell you all you need to know.

name: Tara Rose
text: Horrible service. Not open for package pick up like they say on the back of the slip. Not even sure this is a real federal post office. Can’t believe they are allowed to operate this poorly!

name: EJ Marie
text: I'd I could rate it lower than a 1, I would. First of all, the mail is always delivered late!!! Who wants to wait until 6pm to mail? Furthermore, why don't they deliver packages correctly? It's always something or it's always late. I'm pretty sure people can track their packages & see that's it's been delivered to their post office! Just throw the whole post office & staff away!

name: Marla Johnson
text: I went there to sign up for a new mailbox at my new place. The staff was not friendly at all. Very rude! They had bad attitudes.I do not recommend anybody going there. Avoid this place if you can. When you ask a question, you have to repeat yourself as if they don't understand or you're not supposed to ask. They respond with an attitude. Very nonchalant!

name: Nadja Rhodes
text: I was supposed to have a package delivered before Father’s Day and it even said out for delivery. So when the mail came, i noticed that my package was not delivered. I went back to check online, and it said “held at post office at customer’s request.” I did not request for my package to be held. That wouldn’t make since if the package was already out for delivery.

name: Jessica B
text: Okay service, but the mail carrier at our apartment frequently puts mail in the wrong mailbox at our apartment complex. Residents and office staff have complained, but it doesn't do any good. They also seem to have a high turnover for mail carriers. The few times I have had to deal with the office staff, they have been pleasant. My most recent experiences have been better than the initial interactions.

name: Sharinell Lauderdale
text: Mail is not delivered in the Woodmere area some days.  Postman is not delivering mail on Saturday!

name: David Huneycutt
text: Holy s**t! If USPS was a private business, they would have been out of business a long time ago. Take the one star I give and subtract 6, that gives them a negative 5 stars, the most god awful service on the planet.

name: L Taylor
text: Second time a package has been marked as undelivered due to business closed. Time stamped when my business is open and people are here.  Says it will be delivered next business day and is never delivered.  I have to call the post office.  Then again complaining will do no good.  The people who do not do their job are not in any way disciplined.  In the real world doing business like this would mean me being out of business.

name: Kasey Dixon
text: Worst post office I’ve had to deal with in the entire United States. Constantly deliver to incorrect addresses, sometimes don’t even attempt to deliver at all because they are lazy. Terrible customer service. Should be disbanded.

name: Alexis Hughey
text: I was supposed to have my package on Friday. I watched the mail lady at the mail box, but she never stopped by to bring my package. I waited at home all day for my package and then I look online at my  delivery process and it said I was not home for the delivery or the business was closed. I was so pissed. So I called the post office and she goes "it says it was for pick up" then places me on hold then comes back and says " oh we sent it out for delivery". They left no slip or nothing. I think they just didn't want to go door to door because it was a Friday.

name: S Rogers
text: Reading is fundamental!  This post office is pitiful!  The mail often get delayed and the carriers from this location that deliver to my neighborhood, are ALWAYS putting mail in the wrong boxes!!! The addresses are clearly marked on the packages, however somehow they still put it in the WRONG BOX and it ends up being sent back which delays it even longer!!! Is it really that hard!!!! If you don't want to work, quit so someone that can read can do the job!

name: Natquellia Dailey
text: This is the worst!! Post office I've ever been too! I went in to get a mail box key made. The lady put my name in the book and said come back Friday. I went back that following Monday, there was no key made and no request in the book.  The same day I ask can you please put my address in the book? they weren't  taking any key request bc they have no lock.! The lady suggested that I call everyday to see if they have any locks. Each time I call I'm on hold for An hour! I hate that my apartment company deals with this post office !

name: Walter Gibson
text: I had a certified letter sent from Montgomery Alabama (next day), mail to Copperas Cove Texas, and it still hasn't arrived as of May 6th. Once I called I was told the package is in transit, after 10 days you have got to be kidding me !!! The worst experience I have ever had from (ANY) post office. Come on Alabama, we here in Texas are not impressed!!!

name: Vann Montgomery
text: If only there were an option for less stars like perhaps 0!!!

name: Megan Liu
text: Terrible! You may or may not get your packages! They always say they leave a notice but never do and then your packages fall somewhere unknown to any of the employees. Good luck trying to get the manager to help find your missing items, everything is always misplaced. I actually called ahead, they said my package was there and when I showed up no one could seem to find it so I had to wait yet again. I've been waiting over a month for a signature required letter from the state and still have not heard anything from them since I requested redelivery a month ago. Absolutely the worst post office ever!! If they could have negative stars I'm sure they would!

name: Larry Summons
text: Package was supposed to be delivered Monday May 14th, package was delayed. Called the office numerous times with no call back or additional information. Went in person on May 16th and received no information just that they are out to "find" the package. This is gross negligence and extremely unprofessional, how does the sole responsibility of the post office turn into the thing they can not accomplish? How does a 12lb package disappear? The driver or car 73 at this location apparently lost 3 packages... how do you lose three packages when it is your profession to deliver said packages? It defies logic.

name: Tameria Mosley
text: The supervisor there has a nasty attitude. I don't know if your having a bad day but one little question shouldn't have ticked you off that bad. I asked if she could do one simple thing and she acted like she was going out of her way and like I had insulted her by asking for a supervisor not know that it was her. She wasn't helpful or understanding and I'll be speaking to her service manager about her terrible customer service.

name: Neal Smith
text: After I waited in line and got to the next teller the lady spent a half hour trying to find my package. She asked me 3 times for my address of where the attempted delivery was made. After 30 minutes she told me that today's carrier took it out for delivery. That is not what the certified mail pink ticket said that was on my door. It clearly said that it would be at that post office.

name: Amanda Gray
text: Email said they attempted to deliver my package twice (someone was home both times) no package, no slip at the door and called to speak with someone. Told me I would receive my package the next day(didn't happen) and no slip again. Mail carrier will not deliver to the door at my apartment complex.

name: Jeffery’sGirl Friday
text: Absolutely the rudest employee  I’ve ever dealt with. The male employee working inside has a rotten attitude and never has anything nice to say unless you are same race as him. It doesn’t matter how nice you are to him either! Avoid this place if at all possible.

name: Greg Black
text: They don't answer the phone... how do you expect to stay in business when you will not answer the phone.

name: Jon Marshall
text: I went in without my pick up slip, just the tracking #.  They located the package within about 30 seconds and gave it to me with a smile.  Other customers in line seemed to be very happy with the service as well.

name: Asiah Stanton
text: Called them 17 times and someone kept picking up and hanging up in my face. waiting for mail from the being of November to be delivered it’s the 14

name: Nolan Odom
text: The most unreliable Post Office I have ever done business with. I have had multiple packages come through this office and each time, they're either delivered to the wrong address, sent back to the sender, or I was left a notice on my door about needing to go to the post office to pick it up, only to get there and be told that they don't have it or they can't find it. If it all possible, DO NOT go through this post office for the delivery of packages any larger than an envelope.

name: KaDi
text: I wish I could give this post office 0 stars! Service here is HORRIBLE!

name: Elijah Lofgren
text: No problems picking up package/letter.

name: Charles Mann
text: Lagoon park branch has a rude female working there. Fire her !!!

name: Jasmine Austin
text: The drivers are VERY lazy. They pick and choose where they’re gonna deliver at.

name: Charles Heringer
text: Probably the worst PO in the United States. Never answers the phone and the customer service is horrible.

name: Tina Crowell
text: Been waiting 3 days for my apt key and paying $25 for it. 3 days later... still no key even though it was promised the next day. The staff is horribly rude  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

name: Trissue Hall
text: They never answer the phone when I call it's been a week since I been calling I decided to drop everything I was doing today just to see if I get a answer it's 3:51and still no anewer what's the use of this location it need to be only for picking up package.

name: Emily McGowan
text: This post office is stupid and don't do their job. They can not delivery my packages right. If they don't feel like doing their job they say they can't find your address. You are the POST OFFICE YOU DO MAIL so why can they not find my address for my packages?

name: D H A ReelProdiiG
text: Been Trying To Get My Apartment Mailbox Key For Months & They Keep Saying Come Back Another Time . I've Had It With Them

name: Tawanna Harris
text: I hate this post office the carrier for my area is very rude and they stay misplacing packages or mail. Carrier even gave my package to a neighbor without my permission smdh

name: Kirsten Barnes
text: I like this post office.

name: Anthony Waters
text: My phone said a notice was left for my package... no notice, I was home. And now the lady can’t find my package... I think she stole it !

name: Keisha Briggins
text: I went to this Post office two days in a row only to read a sign that said,”No money orders as of right now!” I asked the clerk if they were still out of money orders today and the reply was,”Yes ma’am, we’ll be out until next week!” Unbelievable

name: Chris Lynch
text: Routinely the worst customer service in town, and they almost always find a way to screw up delivery of special packages inbound from international locations.

name: Josh Cordova
text: Very poor service and the delivery takes forever...

name: Chad Simmons
text: Would not accept my mail without a return address. Return addresses are not a requirement of the USPS.

name: Paula Harris
text: Mail

name: Will B
text: I wish I had another post office...

name: miguel montse
text:
Horrible service .
I called on 09/13/2016 at 4:02 pm to make a complaint that I was not receiving all my mails and that the mail man threw my mail box ,the person that answer the phone made me wait for 15 mins and then hung up ,I could heard saying and complaining about her job that she was not supposed to be there ,if you're not happy with your job you should quit ,you don't bring your problems to your work place.

name: J Park
text: Horrible service

name: Debby Dahl
text: I receive other people's packages and mail and my mail and packages aren't being delivered to me. I have filed 2 complaints on USPS website.  An employee left a message for me at work but I have yet to get anything but a busy signal.   This is my second experience trying to have the USPS do their job.

name: Ruby Russell
text: Courteous customer service representatives. They are efficient and very helpful. I use this service instead of going to the post office.

resp.text: Thank you and we will be sure to share your comments with our team!

name: Taylor
text: This place is absolutely wonderful!! Everyone is so kind and helpful. And the drive through is so convenient! Mailing out things aren’t a hassle at all with this place and I appreciate everything they do!

name: Adored Sweets
text: This business and all of the employees is truly Awesome! Their Service w/ the willingness to help is superb & always at it’s Best!!! I have enjoyed patronizing Parcels Too for over 12 years now & I’m always pleased!!!

name: Kristina Grider
text: Great customer service and very prompt.  Had my documents edited exactly how I asked and returned to me very promptly.  Will continue to use them whenever needed!

resp.text: Thank you for your comments! Our team strives to provide great service and we will share your comments with them.

name: Brian Camp
text:
I use them all the time in my homebuilding and real estate business.   They do a great job!!!!
Brian Camp
Waterstone Homes/Lovejoy Realty.

name: Harvey Castleberry
text: Terrible packing. I sent a stained glass light fixture to Jacksonville Fl. Did not make it one piece. FedEx will not pay for damage says it was caused by packing. Terrible way to do business

name: Sharon Jones
text: Very prompt and efficient. Always handles our house plan needs professionally.

name: Tamika Smith
text: I get brochures printed and they are always perfect, folded and ready to go.

name: Brent Goodwin
text: Outstanding products and friendly staff makes Parcels Too Business Center the one place I go for banners and signs.  Been doing business there for 5 years and haven't been disappointed yet!  The staff goes out of their way to help you decide on what products work best for your needs.  I have ordered signs, banners, and prints for the various organizations to which I belong with no problems,  Jim and his staff can work miracles!!  Highly recommend!

name: DR. MEL C. GLENN
text:
Parcels to go has a incredible team of
Professional Staff, They are like family.
Extremely proficient,timely and very
Courteous. Each visit is simply a pleasure.
I highly recommend Parcels to go for all of
your Business needs.

Dr. Mel C. Glenn, Sr.
Chairman/CEO
Glenn Medical Consulting, LLC

name: Deon Edwards
text: This place meets your needs excellent quality in prints and they handle all of Ascension Beautique labels and Signs.

name: Marche' Gray
text: Great shipping hub. Always polite, helpful, professional. A true pleasure doing business here - everytime.

name: Tony Berenotto
text: Great folks. Worked on an event poster and their designer did a fantastic job. The pricing was very good as well.

name: Elizabeth Smith
text: I love using Parcels Too! It’s so easy to drop off or pick up items from their drive through window. Their print prices are great as is the quality. Great customer service as well!

name: Ralph Hare
text: Oh, you know, same old, same old, the usual and the usual is simply FANTASTIC! That's why I keep going back.

name: Lisa Morgan
text: Parcels Too is great! Never failed to get my job on time, Easy to work with. When a job matters, trust Parcels Too!

name: leigh teer
text: As an EBay seller I absolutely appreciate the advantages of using Parcels Too in Trussville. They are always equipped to handle my shipping needs, have a knowledgeable kind staff and a DRIVER-THROUGH! Anyone with small children or in a rush should take full advantage of this service.

name: Marie Kilpatrick
text: Always a positive experience! The staff are courteous, helpful, and kind to offer better and quicker delivery options.

name: Walter Coleman
text: I've been a customer for several years now. The services are excellent and the staff is professional,  well trained and very accommodating.

name: John Hinkle
text: BE CAREFUL - EMPLOYEES DO NOT WEAR MASKS AT THIS LOCATION AND ARE NOT ENFORCING CUSTOMERS TO WEAR THEM

name: Tim & Adri Himes
text: Parcels Too is top notch.  My dealings with multiple staff members have always been positive, whether at the counter or at the drive thru.  Highly recommended!  They make shipping easy.

name: Julia Cleland
text: I Love Parcel Too. They always take time to get a new proof exactly how I want something. They have created Flyers, posters and business cards for me personally, for my ministry and did all of my marketing projects for the office I worked for as well. Always on time or even early. Several times I needed rush orders and they were able to do that as well. Cant praise them enough.

Stolen IPad!!! Stolen package!!!

text: every single time i have a delivery the package mysteriously disappears and not a single person at the store can even find it WITH A TRACKING NUMBER! one guy literally dropped it at the wrong address and let someone sign the wrong name and just left my package, they opened it sent it back and they still couldn’t help me. this is the 2nd time another one of my packages has been marked undeliverable as i watched the driver simply place the note in my mailbox without even trying to come up my driveway. this store is a 100% joke and should be shut down....these people are so ignorant.

text: FAST and FRIENDLY service. What more can you ask for?! Didn’t have to wait in line long and staff was magnificent! Will continue to use this location AND it’s clean!!!

name: Sherry B
text: Fast, efficient, and friendly service!! I was in and out within a couple of minutes. Can't go wrong with fast service. No one likes to stand in line for a long time. Will definitely continue to use this Post office.

name: M Jefferson
text: Stopped here to get some shipping supplies and info for EDDM. Spoke with the Postmaster and she was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable. Not to mention, the office is very clean and quiet.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
YEAH IT'S GOING TO BE A LONG REVIEW SORRY.
I never thought I'd review a PO, but after today's experience I have to leave this review. Normally I have received AWESOME service at the Brookwood location from the nicest people you can imagine. However, today, Tuesday August 4th 2020, we (husband and I) went to the PO around 9 a.m. to send off a package and the young lady that we dealt with was SO EXTREMELY RUDE...for no reason whatsoever. Just last week my husband had to send off something else and the lady that helped him was SO nice; she helped him seal it correctly and as is normal with NICE and FRIENDLY people/employees, she informed him of when the package should arrive, other details, etc. Today was the complete opposite. I don't know if she was having a bad day or what but she was so rude to us. We realized that the package needed some tape on it (we just come home from the hospital from surgery in the package was in the car and we realized that we should stop by the post office but we saw that it needed to be taped up more...which is usually no big deal) and she literally asked us to pay for the tape....I believe she said "if it's not Priority Mail then you will have to pay for the tape." Which yes of course it was Priority Mail, but she hadn't even bothered to ask at this point. However no worries to you Miss Rude Employee... IF IT HAD NOT BEEN PRIORITY MAIL I/WE WOULD HAVE BEEN WILLING TO PAY THE $0.25 or $5 WORTH OF A FEW PIECES OF TAPE.

Anyway, Little Miss Friendly taped it up herself in a messy way of course because it must have really been putting her out from sitting at her seat drinking her drink that she had to put down to "help" us (if that's what you want to call being helped). However with that attitude there was no way we'd dare say anything to her. She flung the receipt and said "here ya go." No, "have a good day," or "thank you," ...nothing.

Folks we're in a different time right now with Covid-19 and there are a lot of people who would like to have a job and having one with the USPS is a very good one so if you don't want to do a job that deals with the public because you're rude and you have an attitude- DON'T DO IT! NO ONE MADE YOU COME TO WORK. ALSO remember that you never know what someone may have been through right before they came in the door. You get more flies with honey than you do with vinegar.

name: J. Jackson
text: Fast and friendly staff. It's also very clean!

name: Melissa Martin
text: Beware of no knowledge of postal activity/rates at this office .   Was told a package destination Mexico would be $96 for the least expensive option.  Went to Peterson with the same package and charged $27.  Crooks???  Or just no knowledge???  Not sure???

name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: Who leaves a review on a post office? I usually never would but these are the nicest people you could meet! Very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. Always get in and out, never pressure you to buy anything you don't need or to ship things more expensive than you have to. Thank you for this wonderful Post Office that is convenient, friendly and the best! Also, I know as for my carrier, I never have packages stolen or missing, she remembers the people on her route! Edit in June 2020, what has happened to this post office?! And I'm not referring to the Covid19 times! I understand that and by no means am referring to this time but it started before that. It seems there is new staff 🤦🏻‍♀️

name: Jamie Dawson
text: Small town, Nice People

name: Megan W
text:
I recently brought in a bunch of Amazon returns for processing, and the manager Flin completed the transactions very quickly and then went above and beyond to prevent me from making a mistake that would have necessitated a second trip to the store and generally ruined my day.

Aside from that great experience last week, all of my other interactions with this store have also been quick and easy. I definitely recommend this place. The only negative about it is that the location is often surrounded by dense traffic and never ending construction. I will continue to do my business here despite that slight inconvenience; the competent and efficient customer service is worth it.

name: Alexander Marbut
text: I'd be weary that the positive reviews here are coming from in-store. I've always been a big fan of online shopping, and before moving to Tuscaloosa I had all my packages delivered by UPS with no problems. Since moving here, every single item I have ordered has come with some problem or other. Every package looks like they were playing football with it behind the store before delivering. I had a high end TV delivered with the screen shattered right out of the box. I actually returned that one, relabelled it, and marked through all old labels with black sharpie--and they delivered it back to my door the next day, drenched in rain. I had to take off work twice to return the same item. Now they won't even deliver to my address--they see I live in a gated apartment, give up, and drop my packages off to be picked up at stores all over Tuscaloosa (CVS, Michaels). So now, every order, I have to spend hours trying to track down where they left my package. The order I picked up today from Michaels was mislabelled, so instead of a tablet I got an Apple TV that I now have to take off work (again) to return. I'm done taking off work to fix their mistakes--I will be paying extra money from now on if I have to just to use another delivery service.

name: Steve B.
text: they've been great - I have a mailbox there for packages and they know my face/number by heart when I walk in haha Shipping and shredding has always gone smoothly too

name: chasdon breland
text: Customer service is great! The staff is eager to help all needs and find a solution to every problem as long as the customer is willing.

name: Austin Smith
text: The staff was super polite and friendly, and were very efficient in assisting me while sending my package.

name: Sheree Johnson
text: The staff is very friendly and fast. They gave me great service.

name: matthew fox
text: I've had a box there for years. The service is great, the staff has gotten to know me and is always very attentive. It's a 5 star store for sure, if it wasn't for the 1 star parking. But being in the shadow of Bryant Denny Stadium, one doesn't expect much there. Over all great experience at this store.

name: Cam Alexander
text:
I’m pretty upset. I’ve never had problems at this location before. I brought in a package that is time sensitive from a student book company. I’m now being charged the full price of my textbook because UPS never sent it out. It’s been 20 days and the package should have been back at the facility in three days. They refused to tell me what happened to the package and won’t find out why the tracking number isn’t working. Never going to this location again.

UPDATE - the textbook company isn’t charging me anymore due to negligence of UPS, so that’s one less thing to worry about. Still wouldn’t recommend taking important items to this location.
