name: Nicole Williams
text: I went into Micheal's around 5pm after work to pick up a package at the UPS access point. The line at the register was long with only one cashier. I don't remember the lady's name, but regardless of the heavy volume she greeted each customer with a smile. She worked as quickly and efficiently as possible to clear every one. I work in retail also so I understand the pressure at times, and she handled it gracefully.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Ann Prisoc
text: Thier location might be ok but the employees are bot so kind nor proffesional. This company truly needs to really improve the service. The rude employees need to learn how to do a better job and how to treat the public better.

resp.text: We apologize your experience at this location did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve your future experience. If you need further assistance from UPS, please contact us with your information via a Private Message or Direct Message on one of our social channels: Facebook @UPS or Twitter @UPSHelp.

name: Austin Beard
text: The woman who was in this office today was extremely helpful. She was all by herself, but was able to help several customers on her own. I'm giving 4 stars because there was a long wait, but this is in no way the fault of the employee at this USPS location. She did the best she could by herself. They need more staff, but otherwise this is a great post office.

name: Steve Sink
text: Let’s be candid — our USPS’s reputation has suffered lately, and I suppose that’s partly deserved. Today I am compelled to leave a glowing commendation about a postal employee at the Trussville PO who was a picture of grace & good cheer under fire. His name is Rico. He was apparently working alone. There was a line when I arrived so I had the opportunity to observe him interact with several customers. He patiently answered questions, in one case a gentleman went on and on about junk mail & coupons & forwarding address — not a hint of frustration from Rico. Another lady left a package on the counter to be mailed. Rico had the presence to ask her to show him the label, which was actually a UPS label, and he gave her directions to the nearest drop-off point. She was visibly relieved by his averting her error. He JOGGED multiple times back & forth to help customers at various stations to attend to them. The electronic payment system was down temporarily — he was not flustered, and gave full dollar change, rounding up in favor of the customer. An older gentleman asked if he needed to wait in line (several people deep at that point) to ask for forms. Again gracious & adroit, Rico provided the forms to him in the same few second time period it would have taken to explain that he needed to stand in line.  Smiling, pleasant throughout, Rico was giving a clinic on customer service! Rico was so impressive I went back to wait in line again to buy stamps, not because I needed them, but in order to ask his name & compliment him for his excellent service.

name: Rita Rubio
text: I always go to purchase stamps or send packages and every time I have had great customer service.  They have very efficient and professional staff to help in the window.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: Great bunch of people

name: ManBirdWatching
text:
I ordered an item from Amazon. Was supposed to arrive on Sunday. I got a message saying the driver attempted delivery but when checking my camera at that time I never saw anyone try to attempt anything around the time given. Then they said it was being held at my request at the Trustville USPS which I never requested. I called USPS waited 5 hours for a call back when it should have taken 1 hour and the person told me he has no idea what this location is doing because the zip code shows the package is there responsibility and NOT the Trustville location. He told me the Moody location should have my package. He gives me the number. I call it. I have a women who interrupts me "Sir, its at the Trustville location and will arrive Tuesday" I told her I was visiting and went home. Why is the package in Trustville. She only repeated it will arrive Tuesday and said you can come in and fillout a change for address (they cant do it over the phone) and I am in FL now. I called Amazon and had the item refunded and have already reordered it. I will never have something shipped through USPS at the Moody location again. Now once the package arrives I am going to have to ask my family member to send it to me in Florida since I went home Monday morning (I was told if I get the item by Amazon I could keep it if I ever get it).

When the guy from USPS is confused and tells me he has no clue what these people at the Moody location are doing and Trustville that sound like a big red flag considering Moody branch should have my package but its in trustville and is arriving 3 days late (He filed a report at the office for me). I even called the Trustville branch 5-6 times with no answers to see if they had my package so I could possibly stop there before I left but no.... nobody answered. The fact they say attempted when they did no such thing plus saying I requested them to hold my package for me to pickup is nuts. I can't even get ahold of them to ask for them to "redeliver" the item. The moody branch lady only told me "It will arrive Tuesday"

USPS for Moody - 1/5
USPS for Trustville - 1/5

name: Steph Brooks
text: Such a bad office.  Very rude. Never enough workers and they never answer the phone.   The post master is never considerate or researches anything.  Horrible service. My packages that I paid Priority mail for, sat in the office for days because THEY put them in the wrong place.  I was scolded for holding my mail when I went out of town.  Truly horrible service and rude

name: wesley hutchins
text:
Been calling for over an hour, says hold for operator then they disconnect the call. No wonder they are going bankrupt! Poor customer service skills!!

Seriously what's the point in even having a phone number for this facility? You all never answer the phone. It has you waiting and then the call drops. Horrible business!!

name: Pretty Princess
text: They have a thief here, and whoever it is needs to be fired quickly. My grandmother never received her 2 Mother’s Day gift! Shame on you to whoever runs this post office.

name: Corey Barron
text: I just arrived a minute before closing. There were 4-5 people in line and the door was already locked. The guy working would not even look up when I knocked. Poor customer service. Now I have to drive to another post office to mail my package. Thankfully, most all other offices are open to at least 2 on Saturday.

name: Mortuary Affairs
text: One of the worst post offices in the northern part of Jefferson Co. Some of the employees are very helpful while the rest aren't very helpful. The "soup" is very knowledgeable of p.o. operations. I've been to this location numerous times but I've never witnessed any of the previous managers/postmasters act in a manner in which he or she seemed to be hasty with the customers or a bigot. Avoid this location at all costs!

name: Brent Parkman
text: Extremely inconsistent on what is allowed for first class tracked mailers. Employees are consistently rude and give off the vibe that they are doing you a favor by handling simple tasks. I hate this is the closest option for me.

name: Jonathan Brobst
text: Absolute worst experience ever with Miss Beth and Miss Tee, who both instructed me to use a readypost envelope when I was searching for a padded envelope in the flat rate section. After unpacking and repacking into a flat rate envelope, they forced me to pay for their mistake and an envelope I didn’t even use. “Sir, I’m not a mind reader” says Miss Beth after asking if she could help while I’m searching the flat rate section for the padded envelope and she instructs me to walk across the store to another section for the readypost envelope. No, no mind reading required ma’am. Just a minimal amount of common sense, and a dash of old fashioned customer service might help. If they offered zero stars, this store would get it.

name: Nicholas Anderson
text: I've been to post offices in slums in Sao Paulo, Brazil that were more efficient and friendlier. Everyone in there is always angry. I dread going in there every time, but it's just the closest one to my house. That's government provided services for you.

name: Zackary Downing
text:
They close about 5 minutes before their listed closing times. I have observed this twice trying to drop off packages at 5:55 pm. This time was according to the time.gov website which is official government time. USPS is part of the government so it should be ran according to government time, not whatever digital or analog clock is sitting on the counter.

If you think you will get there within 5 minutes of closing, do not even bother as they will not let you in.

name: Barbara Abel
text: Pathetic customer service from Clerk 67. He acts like he's doing you a favor to sell you stamps. I hated the stamps on a book of stamps that my daughter went in and purchased. Two days later, my husband took them and my receipt back to exchange the stamps. Clerk 67 refused to exchange them without a payment of $20 extra. WOW! He had the receipt!!!!!

name: Didi Karn
text:
I received a notice in my mailbox that I was not available to sign for a package. My security camera showed there wasn’t an attempt to knock on my door.  Later when I tried to call during business hours, there was no answer.

When I stopped by at closing, the workers were nice enough to allow me to sign for the package and not make me come back the next day.

name: Melissa Anderson
text: Legit the worst post office I've ever been to.  Every single time. I was just in there today and was accused of taking a picture of one of the workers when legit the dude she was training asked me to verify a zip code so I pulled up my pictures to check my screenshot of the address. I even showed her I have no pictures and she still was extremely rude. And another lady who might have been the Post Master, (who didn't witness what this worker did to me) said I didn't need to talk like that but I said of course I'm going to have a defensive tone when I was accused of something I didn't do and am treated like that. All I said was "are you kidding me??" And looked around behind me at the lady there in line who could obviously see what I was doing on my phone and we both just rolled out eyes incredously at them. The lady then moved up to turn my package so she could see my address (she was not the one who was servicing me). So then I did take their pictures since they were so adamant about it (and I was feeling petty at that point lol) and legit was weirded out by her looking at my address. I asked her to turn her name badge over so I could have her name and she wouldn't turn it over. I also mail packages frequently almost always prepaid label print already on the package so literally all they have to do is take the packages. and put them in the back to be sorted and shipped. I've literally done all the work. But they still are so rude and act like it's such an inconvenience to bother them to do their job and take the box of packages. My husband has said the same thing when he's gone for me. Thank goodness other post offices don't act like this but unfortunately this is the closest one to home, not worth it after today anymore though. This is the only Birmingham post office to lose packages at their facility, never to be found again, and I'm legit just waiting to see if these never get mailed out either.

name: bryan clements
text: My package and mail showed it was delivered to my mailbox but was must have been delivered at the wrong address or something. Now I can't get in touch with anyone to find out, and I really needed the part I was waiting on. Wish there was someone there to answer the phone.

name: Mick McMeme
text: I have to deal with several different Post Offices. This one is a pleasure to deal with. Always helpful, always smiling. The Postal Service would be wise to see what is going right here and implement it at other Post Offices (looking at you Pinson, Gardendale, Vestavia Hills).

text: Sent overnight by FedEx from this location on Monday.  Package had not arrived on Wednesday.  I called to check routing number and found out that it was misrouted and won't get there till Thursday.  Lady at Pak Mail was borderline rude.  Never again will I do business there and am still out over $55.

name: Casey Hall
text: This is well run business that always takes care of whatever we need mailed.  Cant say enough good things.

name: Ryan Neal
text: Glad to have these guys so close.  Really convenient.

name: M Stevens
text: Fast friendly service going through the drive through during Covid-19.

name: Scott Fillmer
text:
They do what they are there to do, provide a solid reliable service to ship and they are very easy and convenient to drop off FedEx, UPS, or USPS. They don’t always have a ton of USPS supplies, which is ok but I’d do anything over having to go to the post office, and their prices are almost highway robbery. I get they have to mark up services, and for the most part shipping has become so expensive they are just passing along the cost, but it’s consistently very expensive to just take a box there to pay to ship if you are going UPS/FedEx. If so, get a prepaid label and drop it off, it’s just way too expensive. USPS prices are pretty standard so if sending Priority Mail just use a flat rate and ship from there.

Outside shipping they have a great mail box service that will allow you to get an address that isn’t a PO Box but functions just like one. Prices are reasonable and the service is fantastic. Owners of the Pak Mail in Auburn are very involved in the community and support the area.

name: Erin Martin
text: I won't use anyone else! GREAT customer service!

name: Lauren Vernon
text: I wish I could give 0 stars. Their delivery driver propped a 70 pound gun safe on my garage door. He/she did not knock to let us know where it was. When we opened the garage door it fell on my car!!! Now my car and the gun safe are damaged. To make matters even worse, they are currently ignoring my husband’s phone calls. Corporate said it was their responsibility to pay for the damages, but apparently the local office doesn’t seem to think so. Now I have another package to be delivered by them soon, and I am dreading it. I would purposely not order from any company that uses them if I could figure that information out.

name: Ethan R
text: I guess we're just leaving things on the side of the road now.

name: Kimberly Smith
text:
A pure nightmare! Ordered lawnmower on walmart.com with 2 day delivery. Ordered Fri morning and was given delivery date of Monday. Monday morning at 6:08am, the package was scanned at Birmingham facility and "Out for Delivery" by the end of the day on Monday. Waited for package all day. Approx 7pm, status went from "out for delivery" to "pending". Started
calling for updates beginning Tuesday morning and package just seem to have disappeared. Customer service is obviously in another country and they can't tell me anything. It's Thursday now and still no package OR delivery date. I've offered to go pick it up and was told I didn't have that option. So my $300 paid in full lawnmower is no where to be found and I'm told I "just need to be patient". Who are they to decide when they want to deliver??? I will never use FedEx again nor will I order from any company that uses this carrier.

I hate this company

text:
They do not deliver on time. My shipment has been delivered damaged repeatedly. FedEx corporate should have stepped in long ago and fired the staff. Use UPS, USPS, or DHL.

Update: they returned my package to the shipper after making no attempt to deliver. Company I ordered from (major retailer) made note to no longer ship to this area using Fedex and will only ship UPS moving forward.

name: Tyra Turner
text: This has been the WORST service I’ve received! I’ve been lied to for two days about my package and still have no received it!!! And had a situation with another package just last week! I will NEVER send anything thing else through FedEx!!!!!!

As I told the last person good thing it was not meds I would be dead by now . They need to learn a thing or two from UPS . Worst company to deal with ever .

That someone would contact me, well 2 days later (today) I called again and fedx told me they don't know what is going on and they started a investigation and someone was supposed to have called me. Still nobody has called and my package
has yet to be delivered.

name: Raven Minor
text: Worste shiiping company available. Never seems to disappoint; either shipments are late, no show, missing, broken, or ripped open with items missing.....especially November through December.  My perishable baby food package left birmingham distro center at 7:10am (I live 45min away) here it is 9pm, no package🤔

name: L&S Taylor
text: If I could give it no stars I would. This is the worst place ever. Package suppose be delivered on Monday here it is Thursday and still no package and this was multiple gifts for a Christmas party tomorrow. Even paid for express shipping. Still haven’t received the packages and was lied to when I called them. They stated the company put it for standard delivery and I had the company we purchased for on the other end of the phone that stated no they did not. It was sent express delivery and Belk had sent me the proof. Fedex phone rep still continued to lie on Belk. Then when told we were recording the conversation and wanted to see proof that Belk had sent the shipment out for standard 5-7 day delivery as he told us and have it emailed for documentation purposes he hung up because he knew he was caught in his own web of lies. On top of that, it shows the package has been at the Birmingham facility since the 10th and yet still hasn’t been delivered. The second package shows it is in Georgia and has been for 2 days with no movement. The rep said nobody would answer the phones at the Georgia facility in Kennesaw as well as this Birmingham facility so he couldnt speak with them about why the packages hasn’t moved or been delivered. This place is a total joke and fraud. They charge you for express shipping and never do it. That is the same as stealing from people. They take your money and then do not deliver. Horrible!

name: Google ruined Youtube
text: This Birmingham fedex...They always deliver my package to my neighbor or it’s not on their truck when they stop to deliver. Incompetent

text: Really bad experience! I ordered some medications I needed for this Friday, I ordered on last Monday it was delivered on Thursday to the wrong address, I went to the post office, they took my number, the delivery man just told me “Maybe one of your neighbors has your package, I think I put it in the wrong mail box” it has been happening a lot lately on my apartments complex because I went to the apartments office to see if my package was delivered there, and they said some neighbors complained about the same experience. I hope they be more carefully about people package.

name: Curt Brewer
text:
***** UPDATE 10/17/2018 *****

I have noticed that many personal items of mail that we receive to our P.O. Box have been ripped as if someone has looked in on it.

Please stop this!!!

It happens to most of the items that look like they may be a "Check" or a "Financial Item."

Please, Gulf Shores Post Office, Please look into this.  It happens a lot in the past year.

------------------
End of new review
------------------

I have read several reviews from this place, and people have rated it low. I've seen the volume they do in this post office, and I'm surprised at how patient they can actually be with the amount of people that come through. The building and the property leave a few things to be desired, but for the most part, everybody here is nice and friendly and they do try to help you to the best of their ability!

name: SE Editor
text: Edward provided excellent customer service. He was fast, friendly and efficient as he weighed and prepared postage for the 45 boxes we were sending across the United States. Keep up the good work Edward and Gulf Shores Postal Service.

name: Cody Cothren
text: Everytime i use the post office here everyone is friendly. As someone who uses the post office a lot I know that the Gulf Shores office is one of the better offices around. They have a high volume of customers and mail. Prices are set by congess. Tax dollars are not used, the post office funds itself. Put yourself in the employees shoes dealing with customers that have messed up addresses or came to complain to them and they had nothing to do with that situation, but they listen and try and help. I know I would be a little frustrated sometimes too. Just a thought. Maybe it will make the experience better if you don't come in blaming everyone and just ask for help instead. Most of the negative comments i have read on here are just people whining because they didn't get exactly what they wanted and chances are they didn't pay to get it either. The post office has premium services for just about everything from special handling to restricted. You just have to be willing to pay for the service or properly wrap the items.

name: connie lopez
text: The post office staff from the Postmaster to those that work at the counter in Gulf Shores are always so helpful and very pleasant.

name: Nancy Pfaff
text: Staff is always helpful and patient 😀

name: Stefanie Stortz
text: A big shout out to Dixie and Roger at thr Gulf Shores location. I had a problem today and they worked fast and fixed it on a Saturday!! Thank you so much!!

name: Thomas Davison
text: Would not recommend this post office, Not vacationer friendly. Will not hand out General delivery mail except on Thursday and Friday between the hours of 2pm till 4pm. Called and talked to Postmaster and he stated that they would rather have you rent a P.O. box instead of using General Delivery. They would rather make the money off of P.O. box instead of the inconvenience of general delivery. Now I understand why the post office is going under. Lack of customer service. I explained to the post master it might be a good idea to post the general delivery rules somewhere so people will know. It sounded like he didn't care. Will be using UPS stores in the future.

name: Niconico nii
text: My favorite post office. Go early. It gets packed quick.

name: Jane Randolph
text: Suzanne was so helpful even though it was my error on packages that were addressed incorrectly. Thank you Gulf Shores Post Office.

name: Sean Nichol
text: Every single time my wife or I come in there which is often since we buy and sell a lot on eBay. These people are always so rude and act very inconvenienced. They charge me twice what UPS does for a simple padded envelope. I will no longer be using this post office ever again.

I can't get these reptile bulbs local so I have to order online, only they are usually damaged in shipping even with big labels saying "GLASS BE CAREFUL". Now I have to find someone to drive to since I've been waiting for reshipments of the same product, only to arrive once again broken. Very displeased and will avoid from now on.
